name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Emerald Cedar (Thuja) Hedge (15 ft. at maturity)
description: Emerald cedar displays a bright green foliage throughout the year. They are tolerant to wet soil and well drained conditions. They make a beautiful hedge and grow naturally without any necessary pruning. They look magnificent planted in a group of 3 at a corner of a house. Planted as a main focal point in a shrub bed is another good use for this all time favourite evergreen.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Sonic Bloom Pink Weigela Shrub
description: This is a humdinger of a weigela! Sonic Bloom.weigela are the strongest rebloomers ever seen in weigela. Loads of hot pink flowers in May are followed by waves of blooms until frost. No deadheading is needed to see strong reblooming through summer and fall.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Oso Easy Italian Ice Rosa Shrub
description: PW Rosa Oso Easy Italian Ice is voted the rose of the year! It has orange buds that open to soft yellow flowers melting into pink blushed margins. Easy to grow and has excellent disease resistance. Abundant flowers, a must have for any garden. Blooms all season long without deadheading.

name: 1 Gallon (3.8L) Hedging Cedar 6 Pack Shrub
description: A slow to moderate growing evergreen with a densely branched, pyramidal form. Rich green sprays of aromatic, smooth, flat foliage. Dense foliage makes an ideal informal hedge or privacy screen. Perfect choice for hedges or narrow spaces. Stunning grouped or massed in a shrub border.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Bloomerang Dark Purple Lilac (Syringa) Shrub
description: Bloomerang lilacs are two-timers - and that's a wonderful thing! They bloom in spring like traditional lilacs, then rebloom from mid-summer through fall. Dark Purple is bigger than the original Bloomerang Purple lilac, and has larger, more rounded inflorescenses. This is a strong grower, and will add beauty and fragrance to gardens from spring to fall.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Yuki Snowflake Deutzia Shrub
description: It's loaded with pure white flowers each spring! If you like 'Nikko', you'll love this extra-heavy blooming variety. Elegant white spring flowers appear at the perfect time for spring gardens, and its neat, mounded habit and attractive fall colour make it a great landscape plant, too.

name: 1 Gallon (3.8L) Late Spring Garden Shrub 6 Pack
description: Minuet Weigela - Minuet Weigela has a dwarf sized, dense, rounded shape. The elliptic purple tinged foliage and hot pink-red funnel-shaped flowers provide a light fragrance. As an added feature, the flowers sporadically bloom again throughout the summer. Attracts butterflies and hummingbirds. Features: Full Sun - Mature Ht: 2-3ft - Hardiness Zone: 4-8Common Thrift - This butterfly attracting, low growing perennial produces showy deep pink ball-shaped flowers mid-late Spring. Common Thrift's mounded grass-like evergreen foliage makes it perfect for clumping in flower beds, and borders. Features: Full Sun to Partial Sun - Mature Ht: 15-30cm - Hardiness Zone: 3-9 Pee Gee Hydrangea - A large panicular (giant cone-shaped bloom) hydrangea with white blooms that turn pink in the Autumn months. This is a fast growing plant that gets quite big in size. Attracts butterflies. Features: Full Sun to Partial Shade - Mature Ht: 15-25ft - Hardiness Zone: 3-8Salvia 'Swifty Violet' - A tried and true pollinator perennial. Salvia is drought tolerant once established, deer and rabit resistent, and blooms from late Spring into early Fall. The beautiufl violet blue flowers, and fragrant leaves attract butterflies, and hummingbirds. Features: Full Sun - Mature Ht: 8-10 inches - Hardiness Zone: 3-9

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Brandon Cedar (Thuja) Upright Hedging Evergreen
description: Brandon cedars finely textured green foliage and their narrow upright form make them an excellent hedging plant. Relatively fast-growing, not too tall and very easy to care for, it can be sheared for a more formal appearance. Resistant to winter burn, this multi-stemmed evergreen prefers 6 or more hours of direct sun each day. The average size at maturity reaches 12 to 15 feet tall, with a spread of 6 to 8 feet. A great solution for landscapes where space is an issue as it stays very narrow.

name: 1 Gallon (3.8L) Early Spring Phlox Garden Shrub 6 Pack
description: Drummonds Pink Phlox - With vibrant blooms, this hot pink Phlox is sure to pull attention. A consistently reliable annual, this phlox is ideal for rock gardens, naturalized areas, beds and borders, or underplanting shrubs. Phlox is a wonderful companion for tulips and daffodils. Attracts butterflies, and deer resistent. Mature Ht: 4-6inches Amazing Grace Phlox - An excellent perennial, this creeping Moss Phlox has pristine white flowers which smother the dark green foliage mid to late Spring. A vigorous moss like cushion adding splashes of colour for about 3-4 weeks, this Phlox is perfect for groundcover, rock gardens/walls, or garden borders. Amazing Grace Phlox is a wonderful companion for tulips and daffodils. Attracts butterflies, and deer resistent. Mature Ht: 4-6inches Emerald Blue Phlox - Noted for its beautiful blue, and very full flowers, this Phlox is a semi-evergreen herbaceous perennial. Forming a mat of rich blue flowers mid to late spring. Phlox is a wonderful companion for tulips and daffodils. Attracts butterflies, and deer resistent. Mature Ht: 1-2ft

name: 1 Gallon (3.8L) Boxwood Shrub 6 Pack
description: Small compact shrub with glossy, dark green leaves. Slow growing. Retains colour year round, often turning yellowish/green during winter. Deer resistant and disease-free. The most widely used plant for creating short hedges along borders, walkways, rock gardens. Very east to prune any time of year with just shears or hand held pruners. Great plant for novice gardeners to prune into round and square shapes.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Bloodgood Japanese Maple (Acer) Tree
description: Ready to create your own zen-like oasis? Bloodgood Japanese Maple is a very popular, small landscape tree, with lacy purple-red leaves from spring through fall. This slow-growing specimen provides serene beauty and dappled shade for many years of enjoyment. It is an easy-going tree, happy in most growing conditions. It will thrive in moist, organically rich and slightly acidic soil; adding additional mulch around the base of the tree will retain moisture and keep roots cool. Best colour in partial sun, but can tolerate full sun. Japanese Maples are also delightful in large decorative pots on the patio.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Purpleleaf Sandcherry (Prunus) Shrub
description: A hardy and colourful attractive shrub with very fragrant pinkish white flowers in spring. The rich purple-red leaves remain all season. Blackish-purple fruit in summer attract birds to your garden. Excellent for contrasts in a small landscape. Most effective uses include hedging, mass plantings where grouped plants have a very impactful eye catching appeal. Purpleleaf Sandcherry are easily pruned after flowering. It is good every two years to prune out old wood, especially in the centre of the plant to produce more new growth, give you more flowers, and create good air flow throughout the plant.

name: 13cm Olive Tree Tropical Shrub
description: The Olive Tree is from the Oleacea family. It can be displayed outdoors in the summer or as an indoor item in the cold season. It requires little maintenance and has a slow growth. It is a trendy item on social media platforms

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Dappled Willow (Salix) Shrub
description: An improved version of 'Hakuro-nishiki'. Spectacular deep pink, green and white foliage all season. This cultivar retains a strong pink/white colour throughout the growing season. Dappled Willow grows very rapidly. Leave lots of room in the garden when planting. Useful as a main focal point in the garden, hedging, screening. Can be easily pruned several times spring through fall. A very good solution if you are looking for a fast growing plant!

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Moonrock Hydrangea (paniculata) Flowering Shrub
description: Get ready to elevate your outdoor appeal with Moonrock.  Creamy blooms emerge with an intense lime-green center that's both funky and elegant. Sturdy stems make for an amazing for cut flower bouquet!

name: 1 Gallon (3.8L) Evergreen Mix Shrub 6 Pack
description: Emerald Cedar - A slow to moderate growing evergreen with a densely branched, pyramidal form. Rich green sprays of aromatic, smooth, flat foliage. Dense foliage makes an ideal informal hedge or privacy screen. Perfect choice for hedges or narrow spaces. Stunning grouped or massed in a shrub border.Mops False Cypress - The Mops False Cypress is truly a ground-hugging mop-like evergreen with stringy leaves that have a gorgeous golden hue throughout the year. This full sun loving Cypress is a superior accent to add a nice contrast to green conifer planting. Blue Star Juniper - This dwarf evergreen shrub forms a beautiful silver-blue globe shaped mound that changes to a purplish heather-blue in the winter months. This evergreen looks fantastic in rock gardens. The readiness of each product in this 6 pack may vary. For example: In early Spring, some items may still be dormant. Please refer to the item tags for more information.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Dwarf Alberta Spruce (Picea) Shrub
description: Dwarf Alberta Spruce is a native, pyramidal shaped tree with Bluish-Green needles all year round. This specimen is drought tolerant, making it low maintenance and easy to care for.   Planting Dwarf Alberta Spruce makes an excellent selection to add texture and drama to any landscape. This specimen is Dwarf, conical variety with very dense, bright green foliage turning grey green when mature.    This deer resistant dwarf tree prefers moist, neutral to acidic, well drained soil. Plant in bright light for optimal growth.  Keeps its symmetrical shape with minimal, to no pruning required.  Dress it up for the holidays, with it's natural Christmas Tree Shape, for a warm welcome to guests and visitors.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Morden Blush Flowering Shrub Rose
description: Super-hardy, made-in-Canada rose! Bred at the Morden Research Centre in Manitoba, this Parkland style rose produces clusters of soft pink to ivory tea-like roses on a tough, very cold-hardy plant. Sweetly fragrant and  low-growing, with glossy green foliage. Excellent flowers for cutting. Blooms turn to vibrant orange hips in the fall. Disease-resistant and low-maintenance, a truly wonderful addition to any sunny spot in the garden.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Lemony Lace Elderberry (Sambucus) Shrub
description: Ever wish our popular Black Lace elderberry came in a sunny bright yellow? We are happy to oblige: Lemony Lace.offers finely dissected foliage but in a cheery gold colour to really light up your landscape. This North American native produces big clusters of white flowers in early spring before the foliage emerges, then bright yellow leaves take over, edged in red. As the foliage ages, it turns an attractive chartreuse. Though it is a large plant, it can be pruned to stay smaller if you'd like. A People's Choice Award winner at the 2014 Farwest Horticulture Trade Show, Lemony Lace Sambucus also won a Green Thumb Award from the Direct Gardening Association.

name: 38-inch x 15-inch Emerald Cedar Tree (Grows to 15 ft.)
description: The Emerald Cedar is ideal for those seeking a lush, evergreen privacy screen with minimal upkeep. Renowned for its vibrant green foliage and classic, narrow pyramidal shape, the Emerald Cedar offers year-round beauty with minimal maintenance. Its dense growth habit makes it perfect for creating natural borders or adding a touch of elegance to your landscape.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW Show Off Forsythia Shrub
description: Bright yellow early spring flowers. Improved flower display compared to older varieties. Compact. Deer resistant. Good for cut displays. Show Off is not your typical forsythia! It is compact and full of blooms from the ground to the end of every stem. Older varieties can become out of control and often become victims of bad pruning; this little beauty will stay small so there is no need to prune. Now you can have a nice tight, compact forsythia hedge without doing any work. Show Off is a very showy choice for the early spring garden.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Green Velvet Boxwood (Buxus) Evergreen Shrub
description: Small compact shrub with glossy, dark green leaves. Slow growing. Retains colour year round, often turning yellowish/green during winter. Deer resistant and disease-free. The most widely used plant for creating short hedges along borders, walkways, rock gardens. Very east to prune any time of year with just shears or hand held pruners. Great plant for novice gardeners to prune into round and square shapes.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Inaba Shidare Japanese Maple (Acer) Tree
description: Inaba Shidare is one of the most stunning Japanese Maples available.  Deeply cut dark burgundy, almost lace like, leaves cover this small tree all season.  The branches gently cascade down from a strong central trunk, creating the most magnificent display. In autumn the leaves change from their dark colour to a bright awe inspiring crimson red.  For Inaba Shidare to perform at its best, it requires full sunlight and moist soil. When fully mature this plant will grow to 6-10 feet tall and 8-15 feet wide.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) ColourChoice Double Play Doozie Spirea Shrub
description: This Double Play Doozie Spirea is seedless and non-invasive variety, which is beautiful and innovative. In early Spring the foliage emerges in blazing, brilliant deep red. By late spring, the flowers begin to emerge, a bright, glowing purple-red that truly sings in the landscape. And as summer comes on, the show doesn't stop: it just keeps flowering, and flowering, and flowering. Because it produces no seeds, it puts all of its energy into flowering!

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Scent and Sensibility Lilac (Syringa) Shrub
description: Fragrant. Pink flowers. Deer-resistant. Rebloomer. A sweet delight for spring gardens! This dwarf lilac is wider than it is tall, and produces copious dark pink buds which open to soft, lilac-pink flowers. It is very fragrant. Scent and Sensibility came out of the same breeding program as Bloomerang lilac but although it does have repeat flowers through the summer, it does not rebloom strongly enough to be part of the Bloomerang lilac family. But we loved the habit and flowering so much that we had to introduce it. We think it will be a delightful little plant for smaller landscapes, providing lots of colour and fragrance in a compact package.

name: 1 Gallon (3.8L) Broadleaf Evergreen Mix Shrub 6 Pack
description: Mountain Fire Pieris - Fiery red new growth emerges up from the lushious evergreen foliage before aging to a deep green. Drooping clusters of white urn-shaped, lily-of-the-valley like flowers bloom in Spring, and add even more contrast to the red and green leafing. The Mountain Fire Pieris grows best in locations sheltered from wind with some afternoon shade. Make sure to remove spent flowers immediately after bloom to improve next season's growth. Emerald Gaiety Euonymus - This small, bushy evergreen shrub produces glossy, deep emerald green leaves adorned with irregular white margins which often take on a pink hue in the winter. This broadleaf evergreen has tiny, greenish flowers in early Summer. The Emerald Gaiety is a wintercreeper that spreads by creeping stems that root where it touches the ground, and by animal or water dispersed seeds. Coral Beauty Cotoneaster - The Coral Beauty Cotoneaster is an outstanding groundcover that shows shiny green, finely textured foliage. It produces white blooms in Spring, and ornamental berries as the season progresses. The shiny green foliage turns a purple tinge in the cooler fall months, which really enhances the coral red berries. The readiness of each product in this 6 pack may vary. For example: In early Spring, some items may still be dormant. Please refer to the item tags for more information.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Sonic Bloom Pearl Weigela Shrub
description: This Proven Winner's best-seller has white flowers which change to pink. Long-lasting, continuous blooms until frost without deadheading. Attracts hummingbirds. Prefers well-drained soils but fairly adaptable to other soil types. If necessary, prune immediately after the spring bloom. Best flowering occurs in full sun, but light shade isn't harmful, particularly in warmer climates. If desired, fertilize in early spring with a granular fertilizer formulated for woody plants, like a rose fertilizer.Sonic Bloom.Pearl is a humdinger of a weigela! Sonic Bloom plants have the strongest reblooming seen on weigela, blooming in May and reblooming until frost. The flowers open pure white with a yellow throat and then change to pink, giving you multiple colours on a single plant. The flowers really pop against the bright green foliage.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Danica Globe Cedar (Thuja) Shrub
description: A slow growing, dwarf globe-shaped selection with emerald-green foliage. Excellent as an accent plant, borders or for low hedges. Globe Cedar retains its shape without pruning. Extremely hardy and an old time favourite used immensely in the landscape.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Incrediball Blush Hydrangea (arborescens) Flowering Shrub
description: This continuous blooming beauty has huge blush-pink blooms that age to an attractive green colour.  Blooms are elegantly displayed on very strong stems, an improvement over the classic Annabelle hydrangea.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Hicks Yew (Taxus) Evergreen Shrub
description: A versatile evergreen ideal for tall hedges, privacy screens, or foundation plantings. Hicks Yew is a broad, columnar shrub with dark green needles. It is especially useful for its narrow, upright growth that takes to shearing well. Easy to care for, these shrubs prefer 4 to 6 hours of sun each day. Although a slow grower, the average size at maturity reaches about 12 feet tall with a spread of 3 to 4 feet.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Petite Rose
description: The Petite Knockout Rose; stunning, low-maintenance, and disease resistant. With its prolific blooming habit and dramatic, bold red colour flowers, this compact shrub is perfect for decorative containers, small gardens, or mixed borders. This rose bush attracts pollinators.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Essence Purple Lavender Shrub
description: Essence Purple Lavender forms a perfect rounded ball-shaped, uniform, clump of green aromatic foliage with fragrant purple-blue flowers. This plant retains its shape all season without opening up or becoming discoloured. Attracts bees, and butterflies.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Beekeeper Bluebeard (Caryopteris) Flowering Shrub
description: This variety is a true magnet for bees and butterflies with its deep blue flowers that appear in late summer and early fall. Beekeeper is hardy in zones 5-9, prefers full sun to partial shade and will reach a height of 2-3 ft and spread of 2-3 ft, making it perfect for borders or as a specimen plant. It has a compact and mounded habit, vibrant green foliage and flowers that are held on sturdy stems that rise above the foliage. This plant is low maintenance and easy to grow, making it a great choice for gardeners of all skill levels.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Oso Easy Double Play Red Rosa Shrub
description: Oso Easy roses are the rebels of the rose world: disease-resistant, long-blooming, and very easy to grow. This seedling from Double Knock Out. maintains a nice rounded habit and has excellent disease resistance. It's a great plant for creating no-spray, no-prune mass plantings in residential or commercial landscapes.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Kimono Bigleaf Hydrangea (macrophylla) Flowering Shrub
description: Get ready for a floral extravaganza with Kimono! This hydrangea, suitable for zones 5-8, boasts large, fluffy white flowers with wine-red margins against deep green foliage. It reaches 2-3 feet in height and width, making it the perfect size for any garden. It prefers partial shade and is known for its low maintenance, disease resistance and reblooming power.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Royal Purple Smokebush (Cotinus) Flowering Shrub
description: Are you looking to add some drama to your yard? 'Royal Purple' smokebush will do just that with its deep purple rounded leaves that are maroon-red in the spring and turn to a dark red-purple in the summer and an even darker red in the fall. Large pink 'smoke-like' puff flowers emerge in the late spring and cover this shrub all summer long. When planted in multiples, it gives the illusion of a hazy 'smoke-like' appearance. In colder climates, plant in a wind-sheltered area to preserve the blooms. This shrub will grow to 10-15 feet tall and just as wide. Deer tend to ignore this shrub and opt for tastier snacks. For 'Royal Purple' to thrive, it requires full sun or part shade, but full sun is recommended for best leaf colouration. This shrub is not fussy about soil, so an average well-draining soil will do best. This is a show-stopping shrub with a long season of interest.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Snowball Bush (Viburnum) Flowering Shrub
description: Big white snowball type flowers adorn the plant in late spring, early summer. The foliage on this large shrub is bright green transitioning to a brilliant red-orange in fall.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Bridalwreath Spirea (Spiraea) Shrub
description: An old time favourite. This fountain-shaped shrub has arching branches displaying striking snow-white flowers in late spring. The flowers do give a nice fragrance to the garden and last long enough to put on a magnificent show. Easy to care for with little or no maintenance. Prune to control the size if needed every 2 or 3 years. The leaves turn to a nice golden colour in fall that gives Bridal Wreath Spirea a beautiful late season show.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Calgary Boxwood (Buxus) Evergreen Shrub
description: One of the hardiest boxwoods on the market!  As the name suggests, this little shrub was discovered in Calgary, Alberta.  It has small glossy oval leaves and a dense form. Like all boxwoods, Calgary takes well to shearing and can be shaped into a hedge or an upright oval, giving that formal English garden feel to your space.  For a more natural look, skip the pruning, and let the natural form delight in your border garden. Calgary Boxwood is also relatively low maintenance; it tolerates most soil conditions and shows some drought tolerance once established.  As an added bonus, deer and rabbits tend to leave this dwarf shrub alone.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Bloomerang Dwarf Pink Lilac (Syringa) Shrub
description: The Bloomerang Dwarf Pink lilac is a vigorous and disease resistant flowering shrub that naturally grows small and round, at just about a third the size of conventional lilacs. It outperforms other lilacs with its fragrant pure pink blooms that cover the plant in late spring, then reappear throughout summer and fall.

name: 1 Gallon (3.8L) Sun Mix Shrub 6 Pack
description: Snowcap Shasta Daisy - This herbaceous perennial is loved for its abundant floral display and compact size. The Snowcap Shasta Daisy produces a sea of large, pure white daisy flowers with a golden yellow centre, that tower over a lush foundation of medium green foliage. If you deadhead this Daisy, it is extremely easy to grow. These make beautiful fresh cut flowers. Munstead Lavender - A compact Lavender with extremely fragrant rosy purple flowers, this perennial blooms twice starting in late Spring or early Summer, and then again after the flowers of the first bloom have been harvested. trim in Spring to encourage a bushier growth pattern.The readiness of each product in this 6 pack may vary. For example: In early Spring, some items may still be dormant. Please refer to the item tags for more information.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Morden Upright Yew (Taxus) Evergreen Shrub
description: A naturally rounded, upright yew that is prairie-hardy! Morden Upright Yew features dark green, needle-like foliage. Yews are slow-growing and tolerate shearing very well. This is a relatively low maintenance shrub, and can be pruned at anytime. It does best with 4 to 6 hours of sun each day and needs well-drained soil. The average size at maturity reaches 4 to 5 feet tall, with a spread of 5 to 6 feet. Perfect for hedging or foundation plantings.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Northern Gold Forsythia Shrub
description: A very hardy shrub with an upright growth habit that fits perfectly in the border or foundation planting. One of the earliest shrubs to flower in early spring. Abundant, bright, flashy yellow blooms appear on the upright branches before forsythia leafs out. Extremely hardy and widely used in the landscape.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Baby Blue Colorado Spruce (Picea) Evergreen Tree
description: Baby Blue Colorado Spruce is a tree of great beauty and colour that is retained throughout the year. This grown from seed selection (not grafted) features stunning blue foliage and is deer-resistant. It has a similar growth habit and size to a standard Colorado Spruce, but with fuller branching and thicker needles. Grows best in full sunlight and under ideal conditions can be expected to reach 20 to 30 feet tall at maturity, with a spread of 12 to 15 feet. Once established, this tree is very hardy and drought tolerant. Makes an excellent living Christmas tree!

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Magic Carpet Spirea (Spiraea) Flowering Shrub
description: Bursting out in colour through seasons, Magic Carpet Spirea is a low-growing deciduous shrub that fits almost anywhere in the landscape. Early spring foliage is bright red which then ages to a red-bronze tint on the golden foliage. Summer unveils flat clusters of rose-pink flowers, forming a neat and tidy round shape. After the last blooms expire, cut off the stem just below the spent flowers. This plant is an extremely hardy variety and loves 4 to 6 hours of sun each day. The average size at maturity reaches 2 to 3 feet tall and wide. It is generally low-maintenance and mildew-resistant. Perfect for contrasting and brightening the landscape.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Candelabra Hydrangea (paniculata) Flowering Shrub
description: This award-winning gem will make your spirits burn bright. Candle-shaped flowers bloom creamy white and transition into bright red as summer fades. Sturdy red stems carry the beautiful blooms and provide winter attraction, tastefully contrasting the snow.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Ginger Wine Ninebark (Physocarpus) Shrub
description: Spring to autumn colour, without lifting a finger!  The name ninebark derives from the peeling mature bark, which makes it look like there are multiple layers of bark on the plant. Ginger Wineninebark expands the colour palette for these easy care, native flowering shrubs. Spring foliage emerges a sunny orange colour and matures to sparkling burgundy. Clusters of white flowers cover the plant in late spring, and these age to attractive red seed heads. This disease-resistant shrub does best in full sun locations and cooler climates. This specimen is colourful from Spring through Fall.  Native plant, requiring very low maintenance; no pruning or deadheading is required, also drought-tolerant. With its naturally graceful, arching habit, ninebarks are best left unpruned. Take its relatively large size into account when siting this plant. It makes an especially nice backdrop for other plantings. Plant in full sun for the best looks and performance.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Compact Burning Bush (Euonymus) Shrub
description: A dwarf, vase-shaped shrub with corky ridged, square stems that produces red berries. Bright, dark green foliage turns bright red in fall. This shrub has the all time best show of fall colour than any other plant. Excellent for hedging, foundation planting and tolerates most soil conditions. Easily pruned at any time of year to shape or when planted as a hedge. Great for screening and for the main focal point of your garden.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Peach Lemonade Rose Flowering Shrub
description: This multi-coloured rose is sweet, special and unique! Continuous blooms start lemon yellow and fade to white and blush pink, creating a unique display of colourful roses that will decorate any garden or container.

name: 1 Gallon (3.8L) Grass Mix Shrub 6 Pack
description: Elijah Blue Fescue - A dwarf ornamental grass that continues to be a gardener favourite. The Elijah Blue is mostly grown for its superb bright silver-blue foliage of finely textured "needles" forming a densely tufted mound. This grass sprouts upright flower plumes that mature to a light tan colour in the Summer. This grass is deer resistant. Karl Foerster (Feather Reed) Grass - The Feather Reed Grass is one of the most popular ornamental grasses, and it's for good reason; fast growing, multi-season interest, tall highly valued erect feathery plumes that move gracefully in the breeze, and requires little maintenance.  This grass is deer and rabbit resistant. The readiness of each product in this 6 pack may vary. For example: In early Spring, some items may still be dormant. Please refer to the item tags for more information.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Dwarf Mugo Pine (Pinus) Evergreen Shrub
description: A dense, low-growing mounding evergreen shrub with lustrous dark green foliage. The Dwarf Mugo Pine takes well to shearing and is very tolerant of extreme conditions. In general, it does well in full sun and is ideal for drought areas and very cold climates. This is a slow-growing shrub that will take time to achieve its mature size of 5 feet tall with a spread of 10 feet. Excellent addition to any landscape in rock gardens, foundation plantings, and in group plantings.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PJM Elite Star Rhododendron Shrub
description: The PJM Elite Star Rhodo is an exceptionally hardy and vigorous showy shrub. An abundance of vibrant lavender pink, trumpet-shaped flower clusters bloom in mid to late Spring. This purple colouring provides a phenomenal contrast to its dark green leaves which turn a reddish-purple in the fall and winter. Attracts hummingbirds, butterflies, and birds.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Monarch Prince Charming Butterfly Bush (Buddleia) Flowering Shrub
description: 'Prince Charming' is a compact Buddleia that will easily fit into your urban garden. It will grow in a dense, compact rounded form - keeping its shape all its life. This shrub is commonly known as Butterfly Bush, and for a good reason, as it will attract butterflies, bees and hummingbirds to your garden with its honey scented blossoms. Vibrant pink blooms bore the branches' tips from late summer to early fall, showing up just as other plants in your garden are spent for the season. When fully mature, 'Prince Charming' will grow to 6 feet tall and just as wide.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Arctic Fire Red Osier Dogwood (Cornus) Shrub
description: Arctic Fire Red is sure to not disappoint with its beautiful red stems and compact size. This dogwood features lush green leaves from spring to fall with fizzy white blooms that turn to white berries. In the winter, it shows off its vibrant red branches. Be sure to plant a few extra to use in your holiday arrangements! This easy to care for dogwood is one of the most shade tolerant of the ornamental shrubs. Deer will tend to leave this shrub alone, opting for tastier snacks. For this shrub to thrive, it requires 4-6 hours of sunlight a day and will grow to 4 feet tall and just as wide. It is very tolerable and will grow in a wide range of soil conditions, making it great for borders or mass plantings; it even does well in containers!

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Feather Reed Grass Shrub
description: The Feather Reed Grass is one of the most popular ornamental grasses, and it's for good reason; fast growing, multi-season interest, tall highly valued erect feathery plumes that move gracefully in the breeze, and requires little maintenance.  This grass is deer and rabbit resistant.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Canadian Shield Red Rose Flowering Shrub - 49th Parallel Collection
description: This Canadian-bred rose from Vineland Research and Innovation Centre features glossy green foliage and full, red flowers that bloom repeatedly from summer through fall.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Limelight Hydrangea (paniculata) Shrub
description: This unique panicle hydrangea revolutionized landscaping across North America. Huge, football-shaped flowers open in an elegant celadon green that looks fresh and clean in summer's heat. The blooms age to an array of pink, red, and burgundy which persists through frost for months of irresistible flowers. You can use 'Limelight' hydrangea just about any way you can imagine: as a showy flowering hedge, to screen off air conditioners, as an attention-getting specimen, in containers, flower gardens, or anywhere around your home. A long-time favorite of professional florists, it also makes an excellent cut flower, fresh or dried.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Amur Privet Dense Shrub
description: Amur Privet is a dense shrub with dark green, oval  leaves. It tolerates considerable pruning or shearing and so is often used as a hedge plant. Makes an awesome hedge, is salt tolerant, can take heat bounce. White fragrant flowers in summer is another nice attribute to Privet.

name: 1 Gallon (3.8L) Early Spring Garden Shrub 6 Pack
description: Phlox Blue - Noted for its beautiful blue, and very full flowers, this Phlox is a semi-evergreen herbaceous perennial. Forming a mat of rich blue flowers mid to late spring. Phlox is a wonderful companion for tulips and daffodils. Attracts butterflies, and deer resistent. Features: Partial Sun - Mature Ht: 1-2ft - Hardiness Zone: 4-8Common Thrift (pink) - This butterfly attracting, low growing perennial produces showy deep pink ball-shaped flowers mid-late Spring. Common Thrift's mounded grass-like evergreen foliage makes it perfect for clumping in flower beds, and borders. Features: Full Sun to Partial Sun - Mature Ht: 15-30cm - Hardiness Zone: 3-9 Coconut Surprise Dianthus - This very compact Dianthus is covered in masses of delightfully scented, pure white double flowers, adorned with a claret red eye. Ensure you deadhead regularly.   Features: Full Sun - Mature Ht: 20-25cm - Hardiness Zone: 5-9 Dwarf Coreopsis Yellow - Dwarf Coreopsis (Tickseed) is a perennial wildflower in the daisy family. Its bright showy yellow blooms appear singly in Spring with occasional light blooming in the summer months. Perfect for garden borders. Attracts bees and butterflies. Deer resistant. Features: Full Sun to Partial Shade - Mature Ht: 6inches - Hardiness Zone: 4-9

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Orchid Lights Azalea Flowering Shrub
description: Orchid Lights Azalea is bathed in Lavender-pink trumpet-shaped flowers that cover the whole plant in blooms, supported by dark green foliage that turns bright yellow in the fall. This relatively low maintenance shrub blooms early in the season and attracts hummingbirds and butterflies. It is not particularly attractive to deer as they opt for tastier snacks. Due to its compact, rounded form and coarse texture, this Azalea stands out among other landscape plants. It is also well suited for use in outdoor containers. This variety is the earliest bloomer of the extra-hard Lights series of azaleas. For this plant to perform at its best, it requires slightly acidic, well-draining soil and to be placed in a partly shaded area. It will mature to 4ft tall and 3 ft wide, giving it a low canopy. Under ideal conditions, this azalea can live for 40 years or more.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Morden Centennial Rose Flowering Shrub
description: A Parkland rose with rich pink flowers blooming throughout spring, summer, and fall. Morden Centennial Rose is covered in charming clusters of lightly scented flowers amid healthy, disease-resistant foliage before being replaced by persistent red hips in the fall. It does best with 6 hours or more of direct sun each day. The average size at maturity reaches 3 feet tall and 3 feet wide. A proven favorite for hardiness and flower power.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Dwarf Arctic Willow (Salix) Shrub
description: This hardy Blue Leaf Arctic Willow shrub features finely textured silver blue foliage over purple stems. From spring until fall, the leaves rustle and sway with the slightest breeze, offering beautiful visual interest in the garden. The purple-hued stems steal the show all winter, until new foliage appears in spring. Makes a beautiful deciduous hedge, very low-maintenance and carefree.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Flare Hydrangea (paniculata) Flowering Shrub
description: Just like the flame of a smoldering fire, Flare will attract stares from guests to your outdoor space. Because its compact and showy, plant it along a walkway, in the middle of a border, or in a decorative patio container. And because its low maintenance, youll have more time to relax and enjoy the view.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW Purple Pillar Hibiscus Flowering Shrub
description: You've never seen a rose of Sharon like this before! Purple Pillar.is a totally unique rose of Sharon: it naturally grows as a narrow column instead of a wide, spreading plant. It gets to be just 2-3' (.6-.9 m) wide and 10-16' tall! Think of what you could do with that: screens, hedges, patio containers. Anywhere you need a little privacy and/or colour in a narrow space, this plant is a great choice. Like most all hibiscus, it will do best in full sun. In summer, each stem is packed along its entire length with purple blooms. This unusual columnar habit makes it a real space saver - if you thought you didn't have enough space to grow rose of Sharon, Purple Pillar is perfect for you. Try it in containers, or flanking your front door, or simply as a quirky accent in your landscape. Green Thumb award, Direct Gardening Association; Silver medal, Plantarium 2016. Continuous, long blooms or Rebloomer. Heat tolerant and drought tolerant. Attracts bees and is deer-resistant.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Blue Star Juniper (Juniperus) Shrub
description: Dwarf and compact evergreen with dense, steel-blue foliage. The striking blue needles are very bright and stand out in the garden .The bluish needles retain their colour throughout the winter. Excellent for rock gardens, borders, edging, or training as bonsai. Slow growing. One of the most elegant dwarf evergreens in any garden.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Chinook Sunrise Rose Flowering Shrub - 49th Parallel Collection
description: This Canadian-bred rose from Vineland Research and Innovation Centre features a lightly fragrant blush bloom tinged with exotic coral, surrounded by contrasting glossy green foliage.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Suñorita Rosa Shrub
description: The PW Rose Sunorita has orange flowers and a classic form when in flower. This plant is disease resistant and flowers all season without having to remove old blooms. It is a medium-sized plant, making it a great choice for a  specimen, flowering hedge, or as a backdrop for other plants. It also works well in perennial gardens as it will provide non-stop blooms. This plant is hardy in zones 5 - 9

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Peking Cotoneaster Hedging Shrub
description: This hardy adaptable shrub is the perfect choice for creating a lush, deciduous hedge. Dark green leaves turn bright red in the fall, followed by black ornamental berries all winter.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Ruby Carousel Barberry (Berberis) Shrub
description: Beautiful rounded barberry with deep purple foliage and upright arching stems.  Foliage changes to a stunning bright red colour in the fall, combined with showy red ornamental fruits.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Summer Wine Ninebark (Physocarpus) Shrub
description: Rich, dark purple foliage all season and soft pink flowers in late spring. Adaptable. Easy to grow. Native. This variety has superior resistance to powdery mildew, a common problem with ninebark. Great as a landscape shrub and as a cut flower. Good in groupings and masses, perennial and shrub borders, use in containers (plant in ground in fall). This is a tough, adaptable plant that is ideal for difficult sites.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Limelight Prime Hydrangea (paniculata) Shrub
description: The PW Limelight Prime Hydrangea has bold, bright color blooms early summer allowing for a longer display.  As the green blooms age, they change to a pink and red tone and have stronger stems. This plant is a smaller size but produces dozens of big, beautiful, mophead blooms every year, even in colder climates. Makes an excellent choice for a specimen. Great for a flowering hedge and also makes for a beautiful cut flower.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Koster Hinoki Cypress (Chamaecyparis) Evergreen Shrub
description: Olive to bright green twisted fans of foliage showcase a very unique look and is perfect for rock gardens. Informal, loosely compact pyramidal evergreen. This collector plant can also be pruned as a bonsai or planted in containers.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Sunsation Yellow Barberry (Berberis) Shrub
description: The golden foliage of Sunsation Barberry has an attractive orange cast for most of season, making it an excellent contrast or specimen plant in any garden.  Its dense compact form make it perfect for low hedges, foundation plantings and formal gardens.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Golden Globe Cedar (Thuja) Evergreen Shrub
description: A loose globe-shaped shrub, that requires no pruning to maintain its naturally round shape. Golden Globe cedars feature bright green foliage with a gold tinge, making an excellent contrast plant. Easy to care for, this evergreen prefers 6 or more hours of direct sun each day. With moderate growth, the average size at maturity reaches about 4 feet tall with a spread of 3 to 4 feet. Best planted along walks, as a foundation plant, or low hedge.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Electric Love Weigela Red Flowering Shrub
description: Spark up your outdoor space with the new Electric Love Weigela. Shockingly vibrant red bell- flowers cover dark foliage for a unique look and rich contrast. First dark-leaved Weigela with true-red flowers on the market! Pro tip: to encourage rebloom, trim lightly just after the first blooms have finished.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Ah-ha Tuff Stuff Hydrangea Shrub
description: PW Hydrangea Tuff Stuff Ah Ha is voted the Hydrangea of the year!  A deciduous shrub that blooms continuously from early summer through till frost. Gorgeous shaped blooms can be enjoyed months long. Double florets look like pink or blue waterlilies.  A must have for the garden!

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Sonic Bloom Red Weigela Shrub
description: Lipstick red flowers in spring. Repeat flowers until frost. Reblooms without deadheading. Attracts hummingbirds.The lipstick red flowers are remarkable enough to make this a choice selection, but a burst of flowers in May followed by waves of rebloom until frost make it a must-have shrub.  Deadheading is not needed to keep the plant blooming.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) SuperBlue Lavender Shrub
description: Displaying the biggest blooms of any Lavender, this blue coloured lavandula attracts butterflies and emits a heavenly fragrance. Perfect for edging walkways, setting in patio containers, or making a feature in an english style garden, this compact plant is a wonderful addition in any format. Dry these flowers for a nice fragrant indoors all year; in a bouquet or a sachet. Deer and rabbit resistant.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Silverleaf Dogwood (Cornus) Shrub
description: A multi-stemmed deciduous shrub with a more or less rounded form. A very hardy thicket forming shrub. Can grow quite large for most gardens. Features bright red stems which provide a stunning winter interest. Variegated green and white foliage turns a purple colour in fall. Features clusters of small white blooms in late spring, followed by ornamental white berries in mid-summer.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Dwarf Balsam Fir (Abies) Evergreen Shrub
description: Compact, rounded evergreen; very slow-growing, perfect for tight spaces. Glossy green needles with bright lime-green new growth each spring. Prefers moist soil.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Pugster Blue Butterfly Bush (Buddleia)
description: PW Buddleia Pugster Blue is voted the flowering shrub of the year with it's whole new look for a butterfly bush!  A compact plant with large, blue flowers with tiny yellow-orange eye in the center.  Blooms non stop from early summer through till frost. Hardy, with thick sturdy stems.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Calgary Carpet Juniper (Juniperus) Evergreen Shrub
description: Highly demanded groundcover with low, spreading habit. Soft green foliage that is very durable and tolerant of all conditions. Looks great along walkways or draping over retaining walls.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Goldflame Spirea Shrub
description: Goldflame Spirea is a very reliable colourful flowering shrub that produces deep pink flowers in mid - summer. New growth in spring is golden-yellow, turning fiery-red in summer producing a constant display of colour. Flowers are deep pink. Very useful in foundation planting, mass plantings, hedging. Extremely hardy and can tolerate heat bounce, drought tolerant, and has nice curb appeal.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Dwarf Japanese Garden Juniper (Juniperus) Shrub
description: A low growing graceful, compact evergreen with bluish-green foliage turning slightly purplish in winter. Useful in mass plantings, borders, Japanese Gardens. The arching branch habit nicely compliments formal gardens,  planted next to water features mixed in with companion plants.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Dwarf Korean Lilac (Syringa) Shrub
description: Dwarf Korean Lilac has masses of reddish-purple flower buds that open to lavender, light pink flowers in May. A very prolific bloomer with a pleasant strong fragrance. One of the best fragrant lilacs out there. Looks fantastic as a hedge, planted in mass plantings, as a specimen in the garden. Fantastic to plant in small areas of the garden, or smaller properties where space is a premium.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Pink Beauty Potentilla Flowering Shrub
description: Semi-double pink flowers. Bright green, bushy foliage forms a tidy, mounded shrub. In climates with warm summer nights the color may fade to a lighter shade of pink.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Fiala Remembrance French Lilac (Syringa) White Flowering Shrub
description: Panicles full of small yellow buds blossom into large, fragrant, double white flowers in mid-spring.  Plant this large shrub near a deck, walkway or patio so you can enjoy the spring fragrance.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Maroon Swoon Flowering Shrub
description: Maroon Swoon, with a stunning contrast of dark red flowers against rich green foliage will make people stop and stare. Mounding form with dark red bell-shaped blooms in late spring/early summer, may rebloom in fall. Pro tip: to encourage rebloom, trim lightly just after the first blooms have finished.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Pee Gee Hydrangea (paniculata) Shrub
description: A hardy vigorous shrub with giant, white cone-shaped blooms in early August, turning pink in autumn. Ideal for cutting and drying. Extremely hardy, Pee Gee Hydrangea is a staple in any garden. Can be used as a specimen plant, large hedge, screening, corner of a building or garden.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Diabolo Ninebark (Physocarpus) Shrub
description: Diabolo Ninebark is a very striking fast growing specimen in the landscape. The lush purple leaves appear all season long turning to a very dark purple/red in fall. Pinkish white button-like flowers appear in May. Uses are for screening, hedges, mass plantings, foundation planting, planted as a specimen in the garden.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Bird's Nest Spruce (Picea) Evergreen Shrub
description: This compact, dwarf evergreen shrub has a unique flat crown that resembles a bird's nest, hence its name. Birds Nest Spruce produces bright lime-green new growth in spring. It prefers a sunny location but it can tolerate partial sun. They make a unique, low ground cover and grows to be about 2 feet tall with a spread of 5 feet. For best growth, the soil should be moist with proper drainage. A great candidate for borders, rock gardens, or foundation plantings.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Emerald Gaiety Wintercreeper (Euonymus) Shrub
description: Small rounded shrub with dense, variegated leaves, dark green centres with irregular white margin and pink highlights in winter. Easy to grow, this popular broadleaf evergreen is widely used in both residential and commercial landscaping. The plants bright colourful foliage stands out in the garden. It is good to use planted with evergreens as the contrast is breathtaking. The 'rubbery' type foliage is soft and easy to prune at any time of year. Best uses are planted in rock gardens, mixed evergreen beds, borders, mass plantings.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Double Play Gold Spirea Shrub
description: Golden foliage is accented by hot pink summer flowers. Deer resistant. Low maintenance. Season long colour. Double Play spiraea has both bright flowers and colourful foliage. This compact, low mounded plant has vibrant golden foliage and an abundance of pure pink summer flowers. It adds easy, season long colour to gardens with very little effort. Double Play Gold maintains its compact mounded shape with very little pruning, and has much brighter colour than other gold spiraea varieties.

name: Garden Elements 2Gallon (7.5L) Mango Tango Potentilla Flowering Shrub
description: From late spring to fall, this compact shrub is covered in two toned flowers, orange-red center blending to yellow at the edges.  In cooler weather the orange hue becomes more intense.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Symphoricarpos doorenbosii Pinky Promise 2g (BE) Snowberry Shrub
description: Symphoricarpos doorenbosii Pinky Promise brings delightful charm to your garden. This deciduous shrub features gumball pink berries on rich mint-green foliage, forming a captivating display. With a compact size of 2-3 feet, Pinky Promise becomes a versatile choice for various garden settings, including decorative patio containers, hedges, mixed garden beds, and walkways.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) May Breeze Phlox Shrub
description: Noted for its compact, low growth, and fragrant pale blue-lavender flowers, the May Breeze Phlox is a herbacious perennial forming a lush carpet of blooms in mid to late Spring. These gorgeous flowers feature five, flat petals that start out white before taking on their slight lavender blush. This creeping perennial is perfect for groundcover, rock gardens/walls, or underplanting shrubs and trees. May Breeze Phlox attracts butterflies and hummingbirds, and is deer resistent.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Wine and Roses Weigela Shrub
description: Rosy pink flowers appear in late spring and often rebloom in summer. Rich dark purple foliage all summer. Season long colour. Deer resistant. Attracts hummingbirds. Isn't it romantic! Rosy-pink flowers add a touch of romance when displayed against the dark glossy foliage. The foliage is much darker than that of older varieties like 'Java Red'. It contrasts beautifully with the rosy-pink flowers, making for a high impact display in the garden. This variety produces copious amounts of flowers in spring, and will re-bloom throughout the summer. The trumpet-like flowers are adored by hummingbirds! Try using Wine & Roses weigela's colourful branches in flower arrangements. It can also be enjoyed as an accent plant or used for a dramatic mass planting. It is fast growing and trouble free, making it an easy way to add season long colour to the garden.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Double Play Red Spirea Shrub
description: The Double Play Red Spirea has vibrant flowers and stunning foliage. Gorgeous near red flowers,with burgundy/purple new growth. This shrub naturally grows as a dense, rounded mound. Attracts bees, butterflies and hummingbirds. Makes a wonderful addtion to the garden.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Goldfinger Potentilla Flowering Shrub
description: This very popular colourful flowering shrub is a staple in the landscape. The attributes include a rounded compact habit with dark green foliage and profusion of large, deep yellow flowers all summer long. Yellow flowers beginning in late spring to the middle of autumn. Useful in mass plantings, hedges or as a specimen plant in the landscape. Best pruned in early spring to produce more plentiful blooms.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Stunner Weigela Dark Pink Flowering Shrub
description: Fascinate the senses this season by adding Stunner to your outdoor retreat. Vibrant pink blooms pop against sleek dark purple foliage creating a showy, elegant look. Pro tip: to encourage rebloom, trim lightly just after the first blooms have finished.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Miss Kim Japanese Lilac (Syringa) Shrub
description: Miss Kim Lilac is considered a dwarf lilac. The flowers are pale lavender-blue in spring and very fragrant. The dark green leaves turn bronze red in autumn. They can be planted as a stand alone or in group plantings. Looks great as a small hedge when they are covered in a mass of fragrant flowers.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Thunderbolt Box Honeysuckle (Lonicera) Shrub
description: Thunderbolt is an improved and brightly coloured broadleaf evergreen that's perfect for modern and low-maintenance landscapes. Its striking chartreuse foliage plays well with the colours and natural tones of plant companions, while the dense, tightly cut leaves add a nice texture where it counts. Left to cascade naturally, Thunderbolt will provide a nice focal point on its own or planted in large groupings, even hedged in a row. Because the foliage is so dense and it offers incredible durability, it takes to trimming and hedging wonderfully. Feel free to trim or shape it to your taste and vision for your yard. Perfect for slopes and banks. Adaptable to many soil conditions and often avoided by deer. A landscaper's favourite.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Sambucus nigra Golden Tower 2g Elderberry Shrub
description: This unique elderberry variety features golden-yellow foliage that stands tall and proud, adding a touch of brilliance to any setting. Golden Tower boasts a narrow, upright habit, making it an ideal choice for small gardens, narrow spaces, or as an eye-catching focal point in larger landscapes. Its finely cut leaves create a feathery texture, providing visual interest throughout the seasons. Thriving in full sun to partial shade, Golden Tower is adaptable to various soil conditions, making it a versatile and low-maintenance choice for gardeners of all levels. As the seasons unfold, watch this elderberry transform, offering delicate clusters of creamy-white flowers in spring followed by vibrant red berries.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Aurora Borealis Hardy Flowering Rose
description: The Rosa Aurora Borealis is a versatile shrub that will add color and beauty to any garden and attract pollinators. It's known for its stunning, deep-pink, double blooms that are produced in large clusters throughout the growing season. It has a bushy, upright habit and glossy dark green leaves that complement the blooms perfectly. The plant is hardy in zones 3-9 and prefers full sun and well-drained soil. It will reach 3ft tall and wide, making it perfect for massing in the garden. This rose is disease resistant and low maintenance, making it a great choice for gardeners of all skill levels.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Poprocks Petite Spirea (Spiraea) Pink Flowering Shrub
description: Satisfy your sugar cravings with the sweetest Spirea of all. Poprocks Petite is a beautiful new selection for modern landscapes, featuring a tidy, compact form and eye-catching candy-pink button flowers that pop against rich green foliage.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Mint Julip Juniper (Juniperus) Evergreen Shrub
description: Brilliant mint-green foliage on a beautiful fountain-like form. Tidy grower that needs little trimming. This evergreen is a solid performer and a great choice for borders or mass plantings.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Old Gold Juniper (Juniperus) Evergreen Shrub
description: Old Gold is noted as being one of the best spreaders. This juniper shows off its golden colour all year round. It is a compact and graceful plant perfect for any landscape, including rock gardens, coastal gardens, and foundation planting. Drought tolerant when established, making it an excellent choice for a water-wise garden. Old Gold is a very low maintenance shrub. It requires no pruning and will tolerate a wide range of soils. For this shrub to perform at its best, it requires 6+ hours of direct sunlight each day. When fully grown, it will mature to 2 feet tall and 4 feet wide.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Rose Glow Barberry (Berberis) Shrub
description: Rosy Glow Barberry is a showy shrub with white and pink variegated leaves. Its yellow flowers are followed by bright red berries in fall that persist into winter. Thorny branches don't detract from its charm. This slow growing shrub can be easily pruned throughout the gardening season. The best uses for the Rosy Glow Barberry include hedges, privacy screening, foundation planting, or as the main focal point in your garden.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Pearl Potion Korean Lilac (Syringa) Shrub
description: Pearl Potion delivers all the great lilac qualities we love in an improved compact form. Each spring, pure white fragrant flowers blossom to make your outdoor space a sweeter place. And because its easier to maintain, you can spend your extra time relaxing and breathing in the wonderful scents of spring.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Sensation French Lilac (Syringa) Purple Flowering Shrub
description: This lilac features show stopping mid-season blooms that are uniquely coloured deep purple flowers edged in white. Very upright habit, heavily fragranced blooms.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Ringo-All-Star Rosa Shrub
description: The flowers on this magnificent shrub start out a rich melon-orange with a cherry-red centre. As these blooms age, it transforms to a lavender and pink. This multi colour bloom creates an eye catching intrigue for anyone who passes by. Along with it's visual beauty, this rose bush is also a pollinator; a crown of fluffy yellow anthers bedecks the centre of each blossom. This plant is dear resistent.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Snowmound Spirea (Spiraea) Flowering Shrub
description: Small, blue tinged leaves on arching branches contrast beautifully with pure white flowers. Dense habit makes it a great choice for hedging and foundation planting.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Little Lime Hydrangea (paniculata) Shrub
description: Compared to its famous sibling 'Limelight', Little Lime hardy hydrangea (Hydrangea paniculata) may seem like a pipsqueak. Don't let this petite shrub fool you. While maintaining its short stature of 3-5' tall and wide, it really packs a visual punch in the garden. In summer, lime green blooms open on strong stems no drooping here. As it ages, rich pink colouring emerges to prolong the show through fall. Little Lime hydrangea is small enough to grow in containers and also stands out as a bold mass planting. Its bright bloom colouration makes it an excellent choice for cut flower gardens and can be used fresh or dried. This reliable performer blooms on new wood, so a quick trim in late winter or early spring will encourage fresh growth and an abundance of buds. Like most hardy hydrangeas, it is hardy to Zone 3 and does best in full sun or part shade. Summer flowers open soft green and turn pink and burgundy in fall.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Gold Star Potentilla Flowering Shrub
description: One of the best yellow potentillas!  This compact variety is covered throughout the summer with beautiful golden yellow blooms on top of finely textured foliage.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Let's Dance Blue Jangles Hydrangea (arborescens) Shrub
description: The reblooming hydrangea that really does!Let's Dance Blue Jangles is a big-leaf hydrangea that blooms on both old and new wood, with a tight, compact habit that is unusual among reblooming hydrangeas. Large, full flower heads will readily go heavenly blue in acid soils; in alkaline soils, they'll be vivid pink. This proven performer will bloom reliably even in zone 5.The only truly compact reblooming hydrangea.blooms on old wood and new wood, so you get more flowers over a longer periodlarge flowers readily turn a deep blue in acidic soils.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Goldfinger Potentilla Flowering Shrub
description: Hardy, tidy, and carefree. The Goldfinger Potentilla is a mounding specimen with dark green foliage, beautifully highlighted by large yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Resembling living sunlight, they love sunny areas, prefer well-drained soil, and demand little care to look their best. This bright shrub will grow to be about 3 feet tall, with a spread of 4 feet. Use as a striking accent in perennial borders. You will love them, but the deer will not!

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Nightglow Honeysuckle (Diervilla) Flowering Shrub
description: Just like the remarkable hour of twilight when fireflies light up the sky, intensely yellow flowers glow bright against the dark red foliage of Nightglow Diervilla. As the season fades, dark red foliage becomes more intense. Its also easy to grow, so youll have more time to relax and enjoy the view.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Cherry on Top False Spirea (Sorbaria) Shrub
description: With the improved Cherry On Top Sorbaria, experience this plants classic foliage beauty, with the added benefit of the perfect topping to complete your enjoyment. After the white plume flowers finish, savor clusters of bright, fresh-looking red seed pods instead of the traditional dried brown seeds. This extends the seasons of beauty you can enjoy through summer and fall.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Goldmound Spirea Shrub
description: Goldmound Spirea is a very reliable colourful flowering shrub that produces deep pink flowers in mid - summer. New growth in spring is golden-yellow, turning brighter yellow in summer producing a constant display of colour. Flowers are deep pink. Very useful in foundation planting, mass plantings, hedging. Extremely hardy and can tolerate heat bounce, drought tolerant, and has nice curb appeal.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Panther Ninebark (Physocarpus) Shrub
description: With sleek black foliage and stems, Panther Ninebark is the ultimate contrast option for your outdoor space. Plant it next to brightly colored selections for a design that commands fierce stares from guests to your garden or patio. Its resilience and compact size make it a unique, easy to grow choice for modern landscapes.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Alpine Currant (Ribes) Hedging Shrub
description: Small greenish-white flowers in spring produce scarlet-red ornamental berries in fall. This hardy shrub makes a great hedge as it is fast growing and can be pruned to shape easily.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Annabelle Hydrangea (arborescens) Shrub
description: Breath-taking, full, round, massive, snowball flowers.  Great choice for foundation planting, creating soft hedges and mass planting.  Annabelle is one of the most popular and sought-after hydrangea variety.  Drought tolerant and shade tolerant specimen, making it easy to maintain.  Annabelle will bloom continuously throughout the season.  From mid-summer to early fall.  Fantastic for cut flowers, to bring indoors to enjoy.  Dries nicely for the crafter.  Prune back this item heavily in early Spring, to 30cm from the ground, to create best blooming performance.  Mature and well-established plants can be divided and enjoyed in other parts of the garden or landscape.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Dwarf Black Spruce (Picea) Evergreen Shrub
description: Very popular, dwarf spreading conifer with blue-tinged needles. Naturally rounded form, excellent as a groundcover or low hedge.  Requires little to no maintenance.

name: 1 Gal. Green Velvet Boxwood
description: With deep green foliage and a large leaf size versus other varieties, Green Velvet Boxwood are a low maintenance solution performing well in both sunny and shaded locations. Easy to transplant and deer resistant, boxwood are a versatile evergreen, easily shaped for hedges or foundation plantings.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW Miss Molly Butterfly Bush (Buddleia)
description: With its intensely coloured blooms and refined habit, 'Miss Molly' is the queen of the summer garden. Its fragrant flowers are the closest to red of any butterfly bush and appear for months every summer without deadheading. Unlike older varieties of butterfly bush, 'Miss Molly' reaches jut 4-5'/1.2-1.5m tall, so it's easy to work into any sunny landscape. This non-invasive variety thrives in hot climates. Butterflies and hummingbirds will find it as irresistible as you do!

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Diervilla sessilifolia Firefly (BE) 2g Honeysuckle Shrub
description: Diervilla sessilifolia Firefly is a radiant burst of color for your garden. This compact and versatile shrub is a must-have, with fiery golden-orange foliage that instantly adds warmth and charm. Low-maintenance and adaptable, it suits both beginners and seasoned gardeners. Standing at a tidy 3 feet, it's perfect for borders, containers, or as a ground cover. As seasons change, so does Firefly, transitioning to a rich burgundy hue in the fall, ensuring year-round visual interest. Drought-tolerant and pest-resistant, this shrub is a reliable addition to any garden, bringing easy beauty to your outdoor space.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Little Princess Pink Spirea (Spiraea) Flowering Shrub
description: Dense, mounding form with pretty pink flower clusters displayed on top of mint-green foliage that matures to dark green, then purplish-red in fall.  This shrub is very adaptable and tolerates a wide range of soil conditions.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Abbotswood Potentilla White Flowering Shrub
description: Stunning large, pure white flowers cover finely textured green leaves from early spring to late fall.  Butterflies love the long blooming time of this dwarf shrub.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Old Gold Juniper (Juniperus) Shrub
description: Juniper Old Gold is a slow growing spreading evergreen with bright golden foliage. Extremely hardy and retains its bright golden colour year round. Widely used in rock gardens, foundation planting, mass plantings, large mixed woody plant beds. Salt tolerant and very vigorous. Best pruned in late spring to shape if needed. Fairly drought tolerant and can also withstand damp, wet conditions. Looks fantastic when planted in groupings.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Never Alone Rose Flowering Shrub
description: Gorgeous, made in Canada rose! Never Alone Rose is chosen for its continuous bloom, compact form, disease-resistant, hardy qualities. Stunning red double flowers with white centers bloom all summer into fall. The average size at maturity reaches 3 feet tall and 3 feet wide. Helping bring hope to families affected by cancer, proceeds from the purchase of this rose go to the Never Alone Foundation, in connection with the CFL Alumni Association.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Victoria Weigela Shrub
description: Victoria Weigela has dark green/burgundy leaves. Grows well in any type of soil and is easily maintained. The dark pink flowers are shaped like a trumpet and bloom in late spring. They will repeat bloom if you cut off the old flowers after blooming. Victoria Weigela flowers will attract humming birds to your garden in large numbers. they look great planted alone or in group plantings.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Emerald 'N Gold Euonymus Shrub
description: Dense, irregular mounded shrub with bright green and gold foliage turns pink-red in winter. Easy to grow, this popular broadleaf evergreen is widely used in both residential and commercial landscaping. The foliage is soft and easy to prune at any time of year. Best uses are planted in rock gardens, mixed evergreen beds, borders, mass plantings.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Hetz Midget Globe Cedar (Thuja) Evergreen Shrub
description: Hetz Midget is a slower growing naturally globe shaped cedar with rich green foliage. Very compact variety that rarely grows taller than 3-4 feet tall.  Great choice as an accent plant in the garden or in containers.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Incrediball Hydrangea (arborescens) Shrub
description: Massive flowers bloom in summer, and are held up by very sturdy stems. Very hardy and reliable. Good for cut flowers. Native. This stunning hydrangea is a bit of a prodigy. We were looking for a hydrangea like the old favorite 'Annabelle', but one that wouldn't flop over. We found it...and it had supersized blooms, too! This adaptable native plant produces huge flowers (as much as 12 inch across) and is both reliable and beautiful. Flowers open green, then mature to white before turning green at the end of their life cycle. Very cold hardy, Incrediball blooms on new growth so even very cold winters won't keep it from blooming. The flowers are held upright on very sturdy stems, so they don't flop like 'Annabelle' will.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Sem False Spirea (Sorbaria) Flowering Shrub
description: A dense, rounded, compact shrub with impressive white plumes of flowers in summer. Sem False Spirea features unique striping of pink on fern-like leaves with appealing bronze foliage in spring, changing to bright red and orange in Fall. This shrub does best with 4 to 6 hours of sun each day, and at maturity reaches 3 to 4 feet tall and wide. A fine choice as a low hedge or star of the shrub border.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Paloma Blanca Wintercreeper (Euonymus) Shrub
description: Paloma Blanca Wintercreeper is a very distinct shrub featuring stunning white tips. The new growth is white-green, ageing to a dark green giving it an ombre effect, which will lasts for a few months in the spring. Prune your plants in mid to late spring to encourage new bushy growth. Ideal as a specimen, in small groups or in a decorative container. Japanese Euonymus is an easy to care for rugged plant that does well in all types of soil. For optimal growth, this plant requires 4-6 hours of sunlight each day and will require regular watering until established. Because of its hardy nature, Paloma Blanca will grow just about anywhere. When mature, that plant will be 1-2 feet tall and just as wide.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Francee Hosta Shrub
description: The Francee is a well renowned white margined, dense forming hosta with heart-shaped, dark green leaves. Pale lavender blooms appear in late Summer, rising above the leaves to reach about 28 inches tall. This fast growing Hosta is excellent for landscaping and fills the space quickly. The Francee Hosta performs best in part to full shade, which makes it perfect for underplanting shrubs and trees.

name: 1 Gallon (3.8L) Annabelle Hydrangea Shrub 6 Pack
description: Breath-taking, full, round, massive, snowball flowers. Great choice for foundation planting, creating soft hedges and mass planting. Annabelle is one of the most popular and sought-after hydrangea variety. Drought tolerant and shade tolerant specimen, making it easy to maintain. Annabelle will bloom continuously throughout the season. From mid-summer to early fall. Fantastic for cut flowers, to bring indoors to enjoy. Dries nicely for the crafter. Prune back this item heavily in early Spring, to 30cm from the ground, to create best blooming performance. Mature and well-established plants can be divided and enjoyed in other parts of the garden or landscape.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Invincibelle Ruby Hydrangea (arborescens) Shrub
description: The dark burgundy red flower buds of Invincibelle Ruby open to a two-toned combination of bright ruby red and silvery pink. The foliage is extra dark and stems are strong, making this new hydrangea a gem in any garden. It is a strong rebloomer that will be an excellent addition to any garden. Like other smooth hydrangeas, it flowers on new growth and so blooms every year without fail. Adaptable to most well-drained soils. Prune in late winter/early spring and apply a controlled-release fertilizer. Bloom colour is not affected by soil pH. Use as mass plantings, landscapes, naturalizing, cutting gardens, or mixed borders. This beauty will continuously bloom. Deadheading is not necessary. Native specimen. Green Thumb award, Direct Gardening Association; Bronze Medal, Plantarium 2016.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Patriot Hosta Shrub
description: One of the most popular variegated hostas ever, the Patriot Hosta is an ovate shape mound of large satiny, dark green leaves adorned with irregular ivory margins. In the Summer, funnel shaped lavender flowers appear, rising above the foliage mound at approximately 34 inches tall. Cut off the stems after they've finished blooming to encourage plant growth.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Double Play Big Bang Spirea Shrub
description: Massive pink flowers bloom against the bright yellow foliage. Glowing orange spring foliage. Season long color. Deer resistant. Easy to grow. Massive pink flowers of a size never seen before adorn bright yellow foliage. This plant has the largest flowers we've every seen on a spiraea. Foliage glows orange in the spring. Adaptable and easy to grow, this is a great plant for landscaping. Tuck it into your existing mixed border or use it as a mass planting.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Danica Globe Cedar (Thuja) Evergreen Shrub
description: Danica is a versatile dwarf, globe-shaped evergreen with tight mint green foliage. It is very slow growing and is an excellent addition to rock gardens or makes a beautiful border or pathway plant

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW Fizzy Mizzy Sweetspire Shrub
description: An early summer bloomer, the Fizzy Mizzy helps bridge the gap between seasons seamlessly. One of the most shade tolerant flowering shrubs, this Fizzy Mizzy Sweetspire is usable in any garden. With a petite size, and abundant white upright flower spikes, this lovely fragranced shrub attracts people and pollinators alike. This shrub is Deer resistant.

name: 1 Gallon (3.8L) Victoria Weigela Shrub 6 Pack
description: Victoria Weigela has dark green/burgundy leaves. Grows well in any type of soil and is easily maintained. The dark pink flowers are shaped like a trumpet and bloom in late spring. They will repeat bloom if you cut off the old flowers after blooming. Victoria Weigela flowers will attract humming birds to your garden in large numbers. they look great planted alone or in group plantings.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW Blue Chiffon Hibiscus Flowering Shrub
description: The Chiffon.series just got more exciting with the addition of this blue-flowered selection. It has the same vigorous growth and lacy blooms, but with large, single blue flowers. Each is adorned with a lacy center to create an anemone-like bloom. Bold yet delicate, Blue Chiffon.is a star in the garden from late summer to fall. The distinctive flower colour complements many popular late summer perennials

name: 3G Phantom Hydrangea Shrub
description: Boasting the biggest blooms in the panicle hydrangea family, huge conical flower clusters stand out on sturdy stems. Lime green buds open creamy blush pink giving a two-toned appearance.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Mr Bowling Ball Globe Cedar (Thuja) Evergreen Shrub
description: A perfect round ball of finely textured, soft to the touch, sage green foliage. Needles are distinctly different from other cedars, almost feather-like. Requires no pruning to maintain its shape!

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Prairie Petite French Lilac (Syringa) Pink Flowering Shrub
description: Upright panicles of sweetly fragrant pink flowers are displayed on top of blue-green foliage in mid-spring.  This small shrub has a multi-stemmed spreading habit.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Strobe Weigela Pink Flowering Shrub
description: If you blink, you may miss one of the many flashy colors of Strobe Weigela. From spring through autumn, youll see bright pink flowers against green and bronzethen orangethen crimson red foliage. Because its compact and low-maintenance, youll spend less time on care and have more time for dancing or relaxing in whatever way you like! Pro tip: to encourage rebloom, trim lightly just after the first blooms have finished.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Emerald Gaiety Wintercreeper (Euonymus) Shrub
description: Emerald Gaiety Wintercreeper is an excellent choice for hedging and foundation planting. With its irregular growth pattern, this shrub can climb if planted next to a structure. This visually intriguing bushy foliage is edged with irregular white margins and will tinge pink in the winter. In early summer, tiny white-green flowers will appear. This shrub provides year-round interest and is low-maintenance. For optimal growth, this plant requires 6+ hours of direct sunlight each day and will be happiest in average, medium moisture soils. When fully mature, this plant will be 2-3 feet tall and can grow up to 5 feet wide.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW Jolly Good Clematis Vine Shrub
description: The Jolly Good Clematis is a vigorous grower, yet maintains a nice compact size. Abundant light purple flowers with magenta undertones cover this plant all Summer long, making it a perfect addition to your fence or trellis. It flowers on new wood, so simply prune it back to two feet each Spring.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Glow Girl Spirea (Spiraea) Flowering Shrub
description: Glow Girl Spirea is an awesome plant for northern landscapes: a gold-leaf version of 'Tor'! Buds with hints of red in them, open to reveal exceptional white spring flowers. Sunny yellow foliage holds its color well on this round, compact formed spirea. It does best with 4 to 6 hours of sun each day, and at maturity reaches 3 to 4 feet tall and wide. Both hardy and heat tolerant, it doesn't burn in the summer and has outstanding fall color.

name: 1 Gallon (3.8L) Flowering Shrub Mix 6 Pack
description: Peegee Hydrangea - A large panicular (giant cone-shaped bloom) hydrangea with white blooms that turn pink in the Autumn months. This is a fast growing plant that gets quite big in size. Attracts butterflies.Tor Spirea - A compact, rounded flowering shrub with multi-season interest. In the late Spring-early Summer, small, flat clusters of white flowers cover the plant. In the Fall, the leaves turn a vibrant orange, red and purple shade.Miss Kim Korean Lilac - A charming lilac that provides interest over three seasons. Late Spring, the shrub is covered in sweetly fragranced lavender hue flowers which open from a rich purple bud. In the Fall, the Miss Kim's foliage turns from that lush dark green to a luxurious burgundy shade.Minuet Weigela - Minuet Weigela has a dwarf sized, dense, rounded shape. The elliptic purple tinged foliage and hot pink-red funnel-shaped flowers provide a light fragrance. As an added feature, the flowers sporadically bloom again throughout the summer. Attracts butterflies and hummingbirds.The readiness of each product in this 6 pack may vary. For example: In early Spring, some items may still be dormant. Please refer to the item tags for more information.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Spilled Wine Weigela Shrub
description: Landscape Plant of the Year!  Beautiful and versatile! Spilled Wine.weigela shares the fabulous deep purple foliage and bright pink flowers of the classic Wine & Roses.weigela but in a smaller size.
