This useful plant grows wider than tall, making it the perfect choice for edging beds or walkways and for incorporating under windows in your landscaping. Like all weigela, it is deer resistant and very easy to care for. Very colourful even when not in bloom. Dwarf, wider-than-tall habit has many uses in the landscape. Deer resistant.  Use as landscape planting, in mixed borders, foundation plantings, mass plantings. Prefers well-drained soils but is extremely adaptable to other soil types. Pruning is best done immediately after flowering; little pruning is needed. Medium moisture. Fertilize in early spring by applying a slow release fertilizer specialized for trees & shrubs. Follow the label for recommended rate of application.

name: 1 Gallon (3.8L) Summer Garden Shrub 6 Pack
description: Little Grapette Daylily - This charming early season Daylily is called the 'perfect perennial' for a reason: low care, drought tolerant, showy flowers, heat stress immune. The Little Grapette Daylily attracts butterflies and hummingbirds. Can be planted in a flower bed, or container. After flowering, remove the spent blooms and seedpods to encourage rebloom. Features: Full Sun to Partial Sun - Mature Ht: 1ft - Hardiness Zone: 3-9Magnus Coneflower - This sun-loving perennial stands out with its bold, large flowers whose rosy purple petals lay flat out rather than droop, like most coneflowers. The Magnus Coneflower is an early bloomer that attracts bees, butterflies and hummingbirds from early to late Summer, and sometimes with sporadic blooms until frost. Features: Full Sun - Mature Ht: 2-3ft - Hardiness Zone: 3-8Essence Purple Lavender - Essence Purple forms a perfect rounded ball-shaped, uniform, clump of green aromatic foliage with fragrant purple-blue flowers. Attracts bees, and butterflies. Features: Full Sun - Mature Ht: 1.5ft - Hardiness Zone: 5-9

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Little Quick Fire Hydrangea (paniculata) Shrub
description: Dwarf form of the popular Quick Fire.hydrangea! Like Quick Fire, it is early blooming, flowering about a month before other hydrangeas. White flowers transform to pink-red as summer progresses. This dwarf plant fits easily into any landscape, including container gardens. Add it to your existing hydrangea garden to extend the blooming season.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW Let's Dance Skyview Hydrangea Shrub
description: The Sky View hydrangea is a compact variety with large mophead blooms. Flowers emerge a beautiful sky blue with a honeydew-green eye before maturing to a full sky blue. Suitable for garden beds, borders, or as a container plant. This prolific bloomer turns blue or pink depending on the soil pH. For blue blooms the soil needs to be more acidic, for pink blooms the soil needs to be more alkaline. Attracts pollinators.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW Callicarpa PEARL GLAM  Shrub
description: This show stopping berry producer starts in Spring and continues to frost. Dark purple foliage turns into while flowers late summer before yielding violet-purple berries by the hundreds. The Pearl Glam is a space saver with its upright habit compared to other beautyberry varieties. This plant is deer resistent.

name: 1 Gallon (3.8L) Red Prince Weigela Shrub 6 Pack
description: The Red Prince Weigela has a show stopping display of funnel-shaped red flowers that bloom in mid to late Spring. These blooms hold their bright red colouring as they age, and are attractive to hummingbirds. Prune this beautiful deciduous shrub to shape it.

name: 1 Gallon (3.8L) Pee Gee Hydrangea Shrub 6 Pack
description: A hardy vigorous shrub with giant, white cone-shaped blooms in early August, turning pink in autumn. Ideal for cutting and drying. Extremely hardy, Pee Gee Hydrangea is a staple in any garden. Can be used as a specimen plant, large hedge, screening, corner of a building or garden.

name: 2Gallon (7.5L) Rainbow Fizz Spirea (Spiraea) Flowering Shrub
description: Bring a burst of color to your landscape with Rainbow Fizz Spirea. The pop and fizzle of color combinations throughout the season is both surprising and fun! Rainbow Fizz is compact and easy to grow, so plant it in a mixed border, along a walkway or in a patio pot, then water, and relax.

name: 1 Gallon (3.8L) Fall Garden Shrub 6 Pack
description: "Compact Burning Bush - Burning Bush is a very popular deciduous shrub. The dense, multi-stemmed, rounded display turns from a medium-green to a bright red in the fall. The colour changing foliage makes this a fantastic addition to an all season garden. Features: Full Sun to Partial Sun - Mature Ht: 9-10ft - Hardiness Zone: 4-9Peegee Hydrangea - A large panicular (giant cone-shaped bloom) hydrangea with white blooms that turn pink in the Autumn months. This is a fast growing plant that gets quite big in size. Attracts butterflies. Features: Full Sun to Partial Sun - Mature Ht: 10-20ft - Hardiness Zone: 3-8Karl Foerster (Feather Reed) Grass - The Feather Reed Grass is one of the most popular ornamental grasses, and it's for good reason; fast growing, multi-season interest, tall highly valued erect feathery plumes that move gracefully in the breeze, and requires little maintenance. This grass is deer and rabbit resistant. Features: Full Sun to Partial Sun - Mature Ht: 4-6ft - Hardiness Zone: 5-11Ivory Halo Dogwood - Ivory Halo Dogwood is a very hardy and unique shrub in the landscape.The red branches are a nice contrast with snow in the winter. The variegated white and green leaves blended with bright red branches give this plant a striking appearance in the garden. Ivory Halo Dogwood look great in mass plantings and groups. Also very good for foundation planting when mixed with other shrubs, evergreens and perennials. Features: Full Sun to Partial Shade - Mature Ht: 4-6ft - Hardiness Zone: 3-7Minuet Weigela - Minuet Weigela has a dwarf sized, dense, rounded shape. The elliptic purple tinged foliage and hot pink-red funnel-shaped flowers provide a light fragrance. As an added feature, the flowers sporadically bloom again throughout the summer. Attracts butterflies and hummingbirds. Features: Full Sun - Mature Ht: 2-3ft - Hardiness Zone: 4-8"

name: 1 Gallon (3.8L) Miss Kim Lilac Shrub 6 Pack
description: Miss Kim Lilac is considered a dwarf lilac. The flowers are pale lavender-blue in spring and very fragrant. The dark green leaves turn bronze red in autumn. They can be planted as a stand alone or in group plantings. Looks great as a small hedge when they are covered in a mass of fragrant flowers.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Dwarf Golden Barberry (Berberis) Shrub
description: The Spring and Summer season long golden colour transitions to a bright red for it's fall foliage. The Dwarf Golden Barberry produces less fruits and seeds compared to other Japanese barberry cultivars. With the barberry being thorny, it is said to be deer resistent even though it is a fruit producer. This hardy shrub is also drought-tolerant and thrives in a middling amount of water.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice My Monet Weigela Shrub
description: This dwarf masterpiece with pink spring flowers is the first variegated Weigela to be introduced. Variegation changes depending on light exposure - whiter variegation in shade and pink variegation in full sun. My Monet creates poetic beauty in any landscape, blooming from early to late Spring.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW Wine & Spirits Weigela Shrub
description: The Wine and Spirits Weigela creates a great pairing to bring spring flower colour and all season foliage colour to your landscape. It's bright white tubular flowers contrast against the near-black/burgundy foliage to create a show stopping feature in any landscape. Plant this mounded shape shrub in full sun for the best foliage coloration. Enjoy the bees, butterflies and hummingbirds as they visit your garden. Deer resistant.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Stella De Oro Daylily Shrub
description: Among the most popular reblooming Daylilies, the Stella De Oro ranks as one of the highest. The fragrant, and compact perennial enjoys profuse blooms over an extremely long period. It's golden trumpet like flowers open in the morning and wither during the forthcoming night, only to be replaced by another on the the same scape the next day, giving it it's name: "daylily". The Stella blooms from late Summer to Fall and attracts butterflies and hummingbirds.

name: Camellia #3 Pot
description: This evergreen shrub's glossy green leaves gives your garden form and structure as a specimen or accent plant. It also excels as one of the earliest flowering shrubs, bursting into bloom late winter.

name: 709mL (1 Qt.) Hawaiian Punch Hibiscus Shrub
description: Hawaiian Punch are high quality, greenhouse grown Hibiscus. They are easy to grow! These tropical plants offer big, bold, vibrant long-lasting blooms (3 to 4 days of tropical colour, whereas most blooms last only a day). The Hawaiian Punch Hibiscus are perfect for containers and landscapes, bringing a tropical feel to your gardens. They are sun lovers - they flourish on the sun deck or around the pool. Treat hibiscus as an annual in cooler climates, they will not survive a frost but can be overwintered indoors. Pruning helps maintain a nice shape and size and this will also encourage a fuller plant.

name: Windmill Palm 5G
description: This palm cultivar is ultra-hardy and thrives in many varying climates (Northern Alaska peninsula through to southernmost tropical climes). It's disease resistant and suitable for multiple applications: specimen, container, patio or deck. Tropical style right here at home.

name: Azalea Evergreen #1 Pot
description: A popular choice for woodland gardens or shrub borders, available in many forms: small, ground-hugging; or, large mounded shrubs. Flower colour varies in hot coral pink, deep magenta, scarlet red, and soft lavender mauve.

name: 1G Green Gem Boxwood Shrub
description: A naturally globe-shaped boxwood introduced by Sheridan Nurseries in 1973. The dense foliage has the smallest leaf size of all Sheridan Boxwoods and retains its dark green colour throughout the year.

name: 19L PW Limelight Hydrangea Tree
description: This unique panicle hydrangea tree standard revolutionized landscaping across North America. Huge, football-shaped flowers open in an elegant celadon green that looks fresh and clean in summer's heat. The blooms age to an array of pink, red, and burgundy which persists through frost for months of irresistible flowers. You can use 'Limelight' hydrangea just about any way you can imagine: as a showy flowering focal point or as an attention-getting specimen, in containers, flower gardens, or anywhere around your home. A long-time favorite of professional florists, it also makes an excellent cut flower, fresh or dried.

name: 2 Gal. (7.5L) Dwarf Azalea (Assorted)
description: A wonderful addition to any garden that brings bright spring flowers from April through to June. Colours can vary from bright fuchsia to a deep purple and soft white.

name: 8.6 in. Pot Cedar (Thuja) Perennial Shrub 1-pack
description: Emerald cedar selection displays bright emerald-green foliage throughout the year. Great for creating a privacy hedge.

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) Hand-Woven Braided Willow Tree
description: The Braided Willow is a stunning ornamental plant that is known for its unique curved stems, and eyecatching braided pattern which supports a crown of foliage. Willow shoots are a thin, shiny purple shade which contrasts nicely against the small, ovate shaped, light and dark green leaves. This plant adds great aesthetic value to gardens, and can be used for hedging, as a focal point, or as an outdoor room divider. This versatile plant can also be potted and added to patios. To maintain it's decorative, manicured look, cut back top growth in early Spring, before lightly shaping 2-3 more times during the Summer as needed.

name: 2 Gal. (7.5L) Rhododendrons (Assorted)
description: Rhododendron is a staple in every garden.  It has exceptional flowers that bloom in early spring and come in a variety of colours.  This plant holds it's deep green foliage all year long and will grow well in part shade.

name: Cherry Tree 5g
description: Cherry trees are known for their small round fruits, which can be sweet or sour, ranging from vibrant yellow to deep red and nearly black. Sweet cherries are popular for fresh eating and desserts. They also produce stunning spring blossoms in delicate pink and white, attracting pollinators like bees. Thriving in temperate climates, cherry trees require careful maintenance for healthy fruit production, making them a beloved choice for orchards and gardens.

name: 5 Gal. Combo Cherry Tree
description: Combo Cherry Tree refers to a cherry tree that is grafted with multiple varieties of cherry on a single rootstock. This grafting technique allows for the growth of different types of cherries (often sweet and tart varieties) on one tree. Combo cherry trees are popular for home gardeners with limited space, as they are ideal for smaller spaces and allow for multiple varieties of cherries to be grown in the same area. A single tree can yield a diverse harvest of cherries, from sweet varieties to sour ones, all on the same branch. Combo cherry trees usually have a compact, upright growth habit, which makes them suitable for smaller yards.  They typically reach a height of 8–12 feet, depending on the variety.

name: 19L Fruiting Weeping Mulberry Tree
description: A unique graceful weeping accent tree with long pendulous branches and shiny, dark green leaves. Edible berries are produced in late June early July. Useful as a main focal point specimen plant. Good for screening and is an eye catching, talking piece in the landscape.

name: Juniper Assorted #1 Pot
description: Ideal for groundcover in landscapes, spreading juniper is low growing, very hardy, drought resistant, and ultra low maintenance. Foliage colour ranges by variety and includes blue-grey, deep green, emerald green or mid-green tinged with yellow new-growth tips.

name: 11.3 in. Pot Pink, Red, White, Yellow Rose (Rosa) Perennial Shrub 1-pack
description: Knockout Roses are easy to grow and care for. They are good planted along with other shrubs or perennials or on their own as well. They bloom continually and are fragrant. Planted in large groups or a hedge the flowers produce a wow effect in the garden. For best blooming performance, prune back Knockout Roses in early spring.

name: 16-inch Green Velvet Boxwood Shrub
description: With deep green foliage and a large leaf size versus other varieties, Green Velvet Boxwood are a low maintenance solution performing well in both sunny and shaded locations. Easy to transplant and deer resistant, boxwood are a versatile evergreen, easily shaped for hedges or foundation plantings.

name: 3.41L (#9) Patio Pot Dipladenia Flowering Annual Shrub
description: Rio is a bush-type Dipladenia which is beautiful, durable and low-maintenance. Trumpet shaped flowers stand out atop shiny green foliage. Bred specifically for garden performance, Rios are non-stop bloomers for planters, garden beds and hanging baskets. Very little watering required. With built-in water storage in the form of tubers, Rios store water beneath the soil. Rios enjoy 4 plus hours of Sun daily but will also perform well in part-shade. No deadheading required, blooms will fade and fall off. Refer to plant tag for additional care. Our 1Qt Rio is ideal for landscape and DIY container gardening. Fall in love with the beauty and ease of Rio. Relax it's Rio.

name: 12-inch Assorted Magnolia Tree
description: Magnolia trees are known for their large, fragrant early spring blooming flowers and glossy leaves. Typically white, pink, purple, or yellow, they can be star-shaped or cup-shaped. The magnolia tree brings beautiful colour to the early spring landscape

name: 7.5L Mugo Pine
description: A dwarf evergreen pine with green needles, and lovely cones. The needles remain a bright green colour all year round. Clip young candles 33% in June annually to keep rounded shape and perfect form. Widely used in mixed plantings, mass plantings, in rock gardens, borders. Plant forward in your garden. The striking needles soften the garden while complimenting other plants. Easy to grow, salt tolerant, provides very enjoyable garden performance.

name: Climbing Hydrangea 2g
description: The climbing version of the beloved Hydrangea adds multi-season interest to your landscape. Plant it near wooden posts, stone walls, or large trees and watch it grow! Its attractive, glossy dark green foliage brings a three-dimensional quality to supportive structures. In the summer, its flat-topped creamy white flowers create a stunning display. This vine can also be used as ground cover. Although it is slow to establish, the Climbing Hydrangea is easy to grow, low-maintenance, and can live for many years.

name: #1 Packaged Rose
description: The #1 Packaged Rose includes many older varieties that are still favorites.  Former AARS winners, patented and non patented varieties. Several fragrant varieties

name: 2 Gallon (7.5L) PW ColorChoice Bobo Hydrangea (paniculata) Shrub
description: PW Hydrangea Bobo is a deciduous shrub with loads of flowers on a small plant! Large white flowers in the summer, turn pink as the blooms age. It is compact and dwarf in habit, and the flowers cover every inch of the plant right down to the ground. A gorgeous display for any garden.

name: 5G Endless Summer The Original Hydrangea (Blue) Shrub
description: Endless Summer The Original Reblooming Hydrangea is a reblooming mophead hydrangea with classic Nantucket blue or soft pink flowers, depending on soil pH.

name: 1 Gal. Euonymus Emerald Gaiety
description: Small rounded shrub with dense, variegated leaves, dark green centres with irregular white margin and pink highlights in winter. Easy to grow, this popular broadleaf evergreen is widely used in both residential and commercial landscaping. The plants bright colourful foliage stands out in the garden. It is good to use planted with evergreens as the contrast is breathtaking.  The 'rubbery' type foliage is soft and easy to prune at any time of year. Best uses are planted in rock gardens, mixed evergreen beds, borders, mass plantings.

name: 2G Annabelle Hydrangea Shrub
description: The blossoms on this Hydrangea are absolutely massive! Large balls of white that make a great showing in the landscape. The blossoms are borne on new wood, so even hard freezes won't slow this beauty down.

name: 7.5L Nest Spruce Shrub
description: This versatile, conifer is an excellent choice for an evergreen border, or accent plant. The outward-curving branches with dense, dark green needles create an interesting bird's nest effect.

name: 5g Apple Tree
description: Apple trees are known for their diverse shapes, sizes, colors, and flavors, making them visually appealing and versatile in the kitchen. To ensure proper pollination and fruit yield, it's best to plant at least two different varieties. In spring, their beautiful blossoms, ranging from white to soft pink, are crucial for fruit development. Apple trees thrive in well-drained soil and full sunlight. With a wide variety of cultivars, they produce apples of different sizes and tastes. Besides being nutritious with vitamins and fiber, apple trees enhance biodiversity, provide shade and beautify landscapes.

name: 37.85L Baby Blue Spruce Tree
description: A broad upright, pyramidal selection that keeps its blue colour year round. Bluish-grey foliage makes a striking accent to the landscape. Once established grows very rapidly. Uses include hedging, specimen planting, group plantings. No pruning is required to retain its shape.

name: 2G Endless Summer Summer Crush Hydrangea Shrub
description: With a profusion of big raspberry red or neon purple blooms, Summer Crush Reblooming Hydrangea brings floral quality blooms to your garden or patio container. Not only is it drop-dead gorgeous, but it is compact, too.

name: Mexican Mock Orange Shrub
description: One of the best choices for a water-wise and low-maintenance shrub. Glossy leaves are deep green to brilliant chartreuse, depending on shrub variety.

name: 5 Gal. Combo Apple Tree
description: A combo apple tree, is a single apple tree that has multiple different varieties of apples grafted onto it, allowing for cross-pollination and the production of various apple types from just one tree, making it ideal for smaller gardens where space is limited; essentially, you can harvest different apple flavors from a single plant.

name: 1g Emerald Cedar
description: Emerald cedar displays a bright green foliage throughout the year. They are tolerant to wet soil and well drained conditions. They make a beautiful hedge and grow naturally without any necessary pruning. They look magnificent planted in a group of 3 at a corner of a house. Planted as a main focal point in a shrub bed is another good use for this all time favourite evergreen.

name: 5 Gal. Japanese Maple Inabe Shidare
description: Japanese Maple Inabe Shidare is a gorgeous specimen tree with rich, deep colour. Weeping purple leaves turn bright red in the fall. Slower growing. Extremely ornamental.

name: 3.78L Euonymus Emerald Gold Foliage Irregular Mounded Shrub
description: Dense, irregular mounded shrub with bright green and gold foliage turns pink-red in winter. Easy to grow, this popular broadleaf evergreen is widely used in both residential and commercial landscaping. The plants bright colourful foliage stands out in the garden. It is good to use planted with evergreens as the contrast is breathtaking.  The 'rubbery' type foliage is soft and easy to prune at any time of year. Best uses are planted in rock gardens, mixed evergreen beds, borders, mass plantings.  Every garden can use a  Euonymus Emerald Gold!

name: 19L PW Pinky Winky Hydrangea Tree
description: Pinky Winky has an unusual name, and an even more unusual flower. The large white panicles open in mid to late summer, and as summer turns to fall the florets at the base of the panicles turn pink. The flower panicles continue to grow, producing new white florets at the tip. The result is spectacular two-toned flower panicles that can reach up to 16 inches in length! This is a real show-stopper that's also very easy to grow. Adaptable to most soils and both sun and shade, Pinky Winky will thrive in most gardens.

name: 1 Gal. Green Mountain Boxwood
description: Oval shaped with an upright growth habit, Green Mountain Boxwood are a low maintenance solution performing well in both sunny and shaded locations. Easy to transplant and deer resistant, boxwood are a versatile evergreen, easily shaped for hedges or foundation plantings.

name: 19L PW Quickfire Hydrangea Tree
description: Quick Fire.hydrangea blooms about a month before any other panicle hydrangea. Flowers open pure white then turn pink, and will be an extremely dark rosy-pink in the fall. The flower colour on Quick Fire hydrangea is not affected by soil pH. Blooms on this super-hardy and easy to grow hydrangea are produced on new wood, which means that you will see flowers even after even the harshest winters. Beautiful for use as a cut (fresh or dried) flower. Unlike other panicle hydrangeas, Quick Fire also has excellent fall foliage colour for a final hurrah before winter.

name: Lilac Congo Shrub 2g
description: Congo Lilac is a French Hybrid Lilac with gorgeous spring flowers which emerge red and transition to purple. Extremely fragrant, the bloom make an excellent cut flower. This is a multi stemmed deciduous shrub with and upright spreading habit. Blooms late spring to early summer.

name: Tree Dwarf Korean Lilac Std 5g
description: This unique dwarf variety of lilac tree showcases an abundance of fragrant blooms at a young age. Reddish-purple flower buds open a lavender, light pink. It displays a consistently uniform growth habit and demonstrates good resistance to mildew. This plant is well-suited for low hedges and features attractive foliage that transitions to a striking merlot-burgundy color in the fall.

name: 26.5L Lilac (Ivory Silk) Shade Tree
description: Lilac 'Ivory Silk' is a sturdy compact tree that has large fragrant creamy-white blooms and disease resistant, blue-green foliage. The fragrant bloomer is ideal as a centerpiece of any garden.

name: 10-inch Vigoro Honeyberry 2 in 1 (Haskap) Fruit Plant
description: Hascap Combo # 3. Mature size 90-120 cm x 90 cm  Fruit plant flowering in May. Fruits in June. Pear-shaped berries with blueberry and raspberry taste. Two varieties in the same pot.

name: Japanese Euonymous #1 Pot
description: This well-behaved evergreen shrub offers several cultivars, many of which are variegated with white or gold hues on jade green, glossy leaves.

name: 2g Colorado Spruce
description: A broad pyramidal selection that keeps its blue colour, beautiful bluish-grey foliage, and makes a striking accent to the landscape.

name: Assorted Hybrid Lilacs 5G
description: The lilac shrub offers an iconic and fragrant spring experience. Lilacs are important pollinators suitable for multiple landscape applications, including large containers.

name: 7.5L (2 Gal.) Climbing Goldflame Honeysuckle
description: Honeysuckle goldflame.  Attracts humming birds and butterflies.  Climbing Honeysuckle with carmine-red flower buds that gradually change to pink as they open to expose yellow flowers.  Use to soften fencing or to add privacy.

name: Magical Revolution Garden Hydrangea with 150 days of flowering in 12" Deco Planter
description: Fabulous bloomers for your garden! Theres a party happening in your garden from spring onwards - at least there is if it contains the pink, red or blue globes of the Magical garden hydrangeas. These enchanting plants change colour to a fabulous dark red within a few months.

name: 19L Weeping Peashrub
description: Weeping branches with small, light green leaves and pea-like, yellow flowers. Excellent for small landscapes as an accent plant in the front yard. Grows rapidly in any type of soil. Good centre piece in any garden. Looks great with other plants planted below at the base. Used as the main focal point in the landscape. Also looks great plated at a corner of a house or in a large sprawling perennial garden. An all time favourite staple item in any landscape.

name: 3.8L (#9) Hanging Basket Dipladenia Flowering Annual Shrub
description: Rio is a bush-type Dipladenia which is beautiful, durable and low-maintenance. Trumpet shaped flowers stand out atop shiny green foliage. Bred specifically for garden performance, Rios are non-stop bloomers for planters, garden beds and hanging baskets. Very little watering required. With built-in water storage in the form of tubers, Rios store water beneath the soil. Rios enjoy 4 plus hours of Sun daily but will also perform well in part-shade. No deadheading required, blooms will fade and fall off. Refer to plant tag for additional care. Our 1Qt Rio is ideal for landscape and DIY container gardening. Fall in love with the beauty and ease of Rio. Relax it's Rio.

name: 26.5L Flowering Pear (Redspire) Shade Tree
description: In the spring, the leaves of the Flowering Pear emerge as red-purple and turn a glossy green with a red tinge. And to follow, beautiful white flowers emerge in the spring.

name: 3G Green Gem Boxwood Shrub
description: A naturally globe-shaped boxwood introduced by Sheridan Nurseries in 1973. The dense foliage has the smallest leaf size of all Sheridan Boxwoods and retains its dark green colour throughout the year.

name: 26.5L Crimson King Norway Maple Tree with Burgundy Leaves
description: Crimson King' Maple is a vigorous medium-sized deciduous tree adored  for its large, purple to almost maroon leaves which turn brown and bronze as the winter months approaches.

name: WINTERKING ROSE
description: WinterKing Roses are specifically chosen for their cold hardiness perfect for cooler environments.  They are repeat bloomers and very disease resistent.

name: 3 Gal. Baby Blue Spruce Shrub
description: A broad upright, pyramidal selection that keeps its blue colour year round. Bluish-grey foliage makes a striking accent to the landscape. Once established grows very rapidly. Uses include hedging, specimen planting, group plantings. No pruning is required to retain its shape.

name: 2G Hakuro Nishiki Dappled Willow Shrub
description: Small deciduous shrub with variegated foliage dappled green, pink and white. Fine textured pink stems and buds add to its appeal year round. Shrub is great for the border, hedging or in mass plantings.

name: 26.5L CWF Native Serviceberry (Amelanchier canadensis) Tree
description: Canada is home to approximately 451 bird species and billions of individual birds. Despite their numbers, the threats leading to declines in North American bird populations continue to grow. These include loss of habitat, invasive species, pesticides, toxic chemicals, pollution, cat predation, decrease in insect prey numbers, climate change, disease and death resulting from man-made obstacles like wind turbines and impact with windows of buildings during migration. As a result, nearly 15 per cent of native bird species are at risk of extinction. There is something you can do to help improve life for birds in your area.For starters, incorporate trees and shrubs from CWF's new WILD About Birds collection into your garden and landscaping projects.

name: 7.5L Brandon Cedar Tree
description: Brandon Cedar grow very rapidly and are extremely hardy. They have a conical shape with thick, dense,  lustrous green foliage. They can tolerate wet soil and also well drained soil. They look fantastic planted as a hedge, foundation planting, in groups, or as a centre piece in the garden. Brandon Cedar look great when planted with flowering shrubs and perennials.

name: 26.5L Linden (Greenspire) Shade Tree
description: Greenspire Linden is a dense narrow headed tree with small heart-shaped dark green leaves. In later spring to midsummer the tree is filled with yellow-white flowers that attract honeybees.

name: 19L Dwarf Alberta Spruce
description: Dwarf, conical variety with very dense, bright green foliage turning grey-green when mature. Extremely hardy the soft needles display an elegance to your garden. There is virtually no maintenance required and they keep their formal form with out pruning. Good for foundation planting, rock gardens, mixed shrub and perennial gardens.

name: Plum Tree 5g
description: Plum trees are resilient and low-maintenance, thriving in various conditions and producing delicious, soft fruit in the summer. In spring, they showcase beautiful white and pink blossoms, creating an enchanting display. Many varieties are self-fertile, meaning a single tree can provide a plentiful harvest, making them ideal for small gardens. Their compact size and generous yield allow you to enjoy a fruitful oasis in your backyard.

name: Fruit Cocktail Trees 5g
description: Fruit Cocktail Tree is a unique and fun way to grow a variety of fruits in one tidy package. This multi-graft tree grows a combination of two or more different types of fruit from the same tree. It produces a wide variety of delicious, juicy fruits throughout the season. The fruits can be eaten fresh or preserved for later use. The tree is easy to maintain and requires minimal pruning. It is a great addition to any garden, providing a bounty of fruits to enjoy. The Fruit Cocktail Tree is a perfect way to enjoy a variety of different fruits all in one package.

name: 36-inch Rosy Glow Barberry Shrub
description: The Rosy Glow Barberry is a showy shrub with white and pink variegated leaves. Its yellow flowers are followed by bright red berries in fall that persist into winter. Thorny branches don't detract from its charm. This slow growing shrub can be easily pruned throughout the gardening season. The best uses for the Rosy Glow Barberry include hedges, privacy screening, foundation planting, or as the main focal point in your garden.

name: 14-inch Fargesia Rufa Bamboo
description: Add a tropical feel to your garden by planting an elegant, evergreen, clump-forming bamboo. This short and very slender, glossy bright green canes adorned with conspicuous red sheaths.

name: 11.35L Dense Yew Shrub
description: The Dense yew is a slow-growing evergreen, with a dense wide spreading habit. It is a shrub that's often used for hedging, privacy screens, and foundation plantings. It's known for its dark green needles and seasonal red berries which appear in the fall. Can be used as a basic foundation planting for a hedge, screen, or border.  The dense greenery and branching provide shelter and nesting for birds

name: Weigela Red Prince 2g
description: Red Prince is a dense, upright, oval-rounded, deciduous shrub that typically matures to 6-9' tall and as wide. It features dark green foliage and funnel-shaped red flowers that bloom in mid to late spring, creating a wonderful display. Occasionally in late summer to early autumn a less significant repeat bloom occurs. Flowers retain bright red color as they age, that resist fading and are attractive to hummingbirds.

name: Pear Tree 5g
description: A pear tree is a medium-sized deciduous tree that produces edible fruit. It flowers in the spring with white, sometimes slightly pink blooms that have five round petals. Pears are typically harvested from late summer into mid-autumn.

name: 9.46L (#12) Planter Dipladenia Flowering Annual Shrub with Assorted Blooms Colours and Combinations
description: Rio is a bush-type Dipladenia which is beautiful, durable and low-maintenance. Trumpet shaped flowers stand out atop shiny green foliage. Bred specifically for garden performance, Rios are non-stop bloomers for planters, garden beds and hanging baskets. Very little watering required. With built-in water storage in the form of tubers, Rios store water beneath the soil. Rios enjoy 4 plus hours of Sun daily but will also perform well in part-shade. No deadheading required, blooms will fade and fall off. Refer to plant tag for additional care. Our 1Qt Rio is ideal for landscape and DIY container gardening. Fall in love with the beauty and ease of Rio. Relax it's Rio.

name: 1g Spruce Dwarf Alberta
description: Dwarf Alberta Spruce is a native, pyramidal shaped tree with Bluish-Green needles all year round. This specimen is drought tolerant, making it low maintenance and easy to care for. This specimen is Dwarf, conical variety with very dense, bright green foliage turning grey green when mature. This deer resistant dwarf tree prefers moist, neutral to acidic, well drained soil. Plant in bright light for optimal growth. Keeps its symmetrical shape with minimal, to no pruning required.

name: Ninebark Black Summer Wine 2g - shrub
description: Summer Wine Black has the darkest, most dramatic foliage yet. With its rich, saturated color and versatile habit, it's the ideal choice for accentuating your home's exterior. Spring brings white flower clusters to contrast with the nearly-black foliage. Upright stems and small foliage gives a fine textural effect. Top reasons to grow Summer Wine Black ninebark:- Very dark foliage looks striking in the landscape.- White flowers cover the branches in spring.- Easy to grow and low maintenance.

name: 8-inch Snowbelle Mockorange Shrub
description: Philadelphus 'Snowbelle' # 2 gal Mature size 1-1.3m x 1-1.3m Shrub blooming in June and July with a multitude of pure white flowers. Green foliage. Tolerates drought.

name: 709mL (1 qt.) Dipladenia Flowering Annual Shrub
description: Rio is a bush-type Dipladenia which is beautiful, durable and low-maintenance. Trumpet shaped flowers stand out atop shiny green foliage. Bred specifically for garden performance, Rios are non-stop bloomers for planters, garden beds and hanging baskets. Very little watering required. With built-in water storage in the form of tubers, Rios store water beneath the soil. Rios enjoy 4 plus hours of Sun daily but will also perform well in part-shade. No deadheading required, blooms will fade and fall off. Refer to plant tag for additional care. Our 1Qt Rio is ideal for landscape and DIY container gardening. Fall in love with the beauty and ease of Rio. Relax it's Rio.

name: Clematis Happy Jack Purple Shrub 2g
description: PW Happy Jack Purple Clematis is a beautiful and showy flowering vine that will add a splash of color to any garden. Its deep purple blooms are produced in abundance from early summer to late autumn and can reach up to 8 feet in height when in full bloom. The foliage is a deep green and the stems are woody. This clematis is an excellent choice for covering fences, walls, and trellises. It is also a great choice for attracting pollinators to the garden. PW Happy Jack Purple Clematis is a hardy and low-maintenance vine that will bring lasting beauty and color to any outdoor space.

name: Hicks Yew Shrub 3g
description: Hicks Yew is a slow-growing evergreen shrub with a dense, upright habit. This yew is low maintenance and it's lush, dark green colour provides year-round interest to your landscape. It makes a great choice for hedges, creating privacy screens or can be used as an accent plant.

name: 3 Gal. Green Mountain Boxwood Shrub
description: Oval shaped with an upright growth habit, Green Mountain Boxwood are a low maintenance solution performing well in both sunny and shaded locations. Easy to transplant and deer resistant, boxwood are a versatile evergreen, easily shaped for hedges or foundation plantings.

name: 19L Fruitless Weeping Mulberry Acent Tree
description: A unique graceful weeping accent tree with long pendulous branches and shiny, dark green leaves. Useful as a main focal point specimen plant. Good for screening and is an eye catching, talking piece in the landscape.

name: 14-inch Walker's Tree
description: Caragana a. 'Walker' # 7 gal. Mature size 2m x 1m Grafted tree that is flowering in June. Yellow flowers with light green foliage very cut out. Very weeping port with branches touching the ground.

name: 1 Gal. (3.8L) Rhododendron (Assorted)
description: Very vigorous rhododendron with rounded, large leaves. Lilac-pink flower buds before flowers.

name: Coral Beauty Cotoneaster Shrub 1g - Colour Pot
description: Coral Beauty Cotoneaster is an evergreen shrub with dark green leaves. It has tiny, beautiful white flowers in the spring followed by bright pink fruit in the late summer into fall. Great for edges, mass plantings and groundcover. This shrub does best if planted in full sun to part shade.

name: 19L 3-Way Combo Blueberry Bush
description: The first fruit will appear after the spring bloom in midsummer, then it reblooms in summer, providing a late season crop in the fall. The dark green leaves will turn to deep red and greens in the winter, making it a beautiful year-long addition to any landscape.

name: 2G Roseum Elegans Rhododendron Shrub
description: Lavender coloured blooms are produced in large trusses during the spring on this uniformly growing evergreen. Looks great when planted in groups or as a foundation planting.

name: Willow Assorted #2
description: Depending on variety, foliage ranges from rich deep green with a grey underside through to a pink and white variegated mid-green canopy. Ideal as an accent or specimen in the garden due to its graceful form.

name: 2G Silverleaf Dogwood Shrub
description: An excellent choice to add interest to your garden all year long. Spring brings petite white blossoms, which are followed later by white berries. The summer foliage is a lovely minty green with a margin of white.

name: 2 Gal. PJM Rhododendron Bush
description: PJM Rhododendron is a popular variety of evergreen rhododendron known for its compact size and beautiful early spring bloom. It is a hybrid rhododendron, the result of a cross between various species of rhododendrons, and it is highly prized for its ability to thrive in colder climates while still providing vibrant floral displays.

name: Snowbelle Mock Orange Shrub 2g
description: Snowbelle Mock Orange is the perfect shrub for any garden! With its bright white blossoms, this shrub is sure to be a showstopper in any landscape. Snowbelle Mock Orange is an evergreen shrub that thrives in sunny locations and is drought tolerant. Its fragrant flowers will attract pollinators, and its low maintenance nature will make it a favorite among gardeners. Plus, Snowbelle Mock Orange is an excellent choice for privacy hedges. Add a touch of beauty to your garden with Snowbelle Mock Orange!

name: Assorted Aspen Trees #5 Pot
description: Great trees to mass plant and creat a hedge or privacy screen. Works well in windy areas as well. This plant is tough and hardy so it will survive in the harshest of conditions..

name: Hydrangea Wee Bit Giddy Shrub 2g
description: The PW Wee Bit Giddy hydrangea will put a smile on your face. This deciduous perennial has beautiful blooms of pink and white that will add a splash of color to any landscape. It is easy to care for and will thrive in well-drained, acidic soil. It blooms from mid-summer to early fall and is sure to draw attention in the garden. Its compact growth habit makes it a great choice for small gardens or containers. Its strong stems make it a great choice for cut flower arrangements. PW Wee Bit Giddy Hydrangea is a must-have for anyone looking to add a vibrant touch of color to their landscape.

name: 2G Love-A-Lot Hydrangea Shrub
description: Love-A-Lot features huge pyramids of white flowers that open in mid-July atop stiff stems that are perfect for holding these burly 12'+ flower cones. Its compact habit is perfect for even tight spots in the landscape. Its bloom starts pure white, gradually changes to pale pink and continues to deepen in color until it ends up a deep, glorious pink as September wanes and October begins.

name: 26.5L Locust (Honeylocust) Shade Tree
description: A sturdy accent tree with bright green foliage as it emerges in the spring giving this selection a very lush appearance. Fast grower with excellent yellow fall colour.

name: Lilac Katherine Havemeyer Shrub 2g
description: Katherine Havemeyer Lilac is a French Hybrid Lilac with stunning pink flowers that emerge in mid spring. Fragrant and showy, these blooms make an excellent cut flower.  Great for mass plantings, hedges and for adding beauty to your garden.

name: Cedar Hetz Midget Globe Shrub 2g
description: Unlike some of its large to giant Arborvitae cousins, 'Hetz Midget' is a cute little slow-growing American arborvitae cultivar with a distinctive globe shape and flat sprays of attractive, lacy little green leaves.

name: 6-inch Easter Colour Hydrangea Shrub
description: Blooms appear in late spring to summer, often continuing into fall. Strong, straight stems hold the huge flower heads up well. This full, lush shrub needs plenty of room to show off its beautiful flowers.

name: Pieris Assorted #1 Pot
description: This shrub offers some of the season's earliest colour with profuse clusters of long rope-like tendrils of tumbling blooms. New growth in some varieties is red, coral, purple or bronze.

name: 14" Dwarf Alberta Spruce Spiral Shrub Topiary
description: The Dwarf Alberta Spruce Spiral Topiary is a classic evergreen which will add elegance to your landscape. Elevate your outdoor space with this brilliant showpiece accent by adding visual interest, texture and unique form

name: Cypress Golden Mops Shrub 2g
description: The Golden Mops Cypress is very hardy yellow evergreen shrub which requires little to no maintenance. It is insect and disease resistant. Mops Cypress prefers to be planted in full sun but will grow in some shade. The more sun it has, the brighter yellow it will be. This evergreen add interest and colour to the garden.

name: 17-inch Ivory Silk Lilac Tree
description: Syringa r. 'Ivory Silk' # 10 gal. Mature size 8m x 2m Tree flowering in July with cream white flowers and a green foliage. Compact oval shape. Resistant to insects and diseases.

name: 26.5L River Birch Shade Tree
description: A large, oval native that is grown for its beautiful exfoliating tan bark. Used as a specimen. Dark green foliage turns an outstanding yellow in the fall

name: #1 KNOCKOUT PKG ROSE
description: The original Knock Out Rose was introduced 20 years ago and forever changed the way we think about roses. With ten additional colors and flower forms to choose from, plus the flower power and easy maintenance that you know and love, it's no wonder Knock Out roses are known worldwide.  They are disease resistent.

name: 5 Gal. 14-inch Caprea Pendula Tree
description: Salix caprea 'Pendula' on Stem # 5 gal. Mature size 2m x 2m Grafted tree. Flowering in May with yellow flowers. The flowers are followed by littles kittens. Weeping Port. Green foliage.

name: 3G Aphrodite Rose of Sharon Shrub
description: Heavily ruffled, hot pink blooms have a striking deep red eye. Large blooms and deep green foliage punctuate the graceful, vase-shaped habit. Produces little to no seeds.

name: 2DP Décor Potted Green Velvet Boxwood Shrub
description: Introduced by Sheridan Nurseries in 1973, this has the darkest green foliage of the Sheridan Boxwood and a large leaf size. New growth is a bright green and provides good contrast in May and September.

name: 26.5L CWF Native Maple (Acer rubrum) Tree
description: Canada is home to approximately 451 bird species and billions of individual birds. Despite their numbers, the threats leading to declines in North American bird populations continue to grow. These include loss of habitat, invasive species, pesticides, toxic chemicals, pollution, cat predation, decrease in insect prey numbers, climate change, disease and death resulting from man-made obstacles like wind turbines and impact with windows of buildings during migration. As a result, nearly 15 per cent of native bird species are at risk of extinction. There is something you can do to help improve life for birds in your area.For starters, incorporate trees and shrubs from CWF's new WILD About Birds collection into your garden and landscaping projects.

name: 8-inch Emerald Gold Euonymus Shrub
description: Euonymus f. 'Emerald N' Gold' # 2 gal. Mature size 45-60 cm x 1 m Evergreen with variegated green and yellow foliage turning pinkish red in autumn.  Shrub keeping its foliage during the winter. Irregular mound shape

name: 8-inch Japanese Shrub
description: Kerria japonica 'Pleniflora' # 2 gal. Mature size 1,2-1,5 m x 1,2-1,5 m  Shrub flowering in May and June with abundant double bright orange yellow flowers. Green foliage.

name: 3G James MacFarlane Preston Lilac Shrub
description: Purple buds open up to reveal pink blossoms with a lovely sweet fragrance. A superb specimen plant, it is more disease resistant than many other lilac.

name: 2G Velveteeny Common Smoketree Shrub
description: Showy foliage and flower plumes make Velveteeny Smoketree a unique addition to any garden! It packs a punch of colour in a small package - in the fall, the showy purple leaves turn a rich red colour.

name: 3G Minuet Preston Lilac Shrub
description: Compact, flowering shrub known for its profusion of fragrant, light purple flowers in May. Excellent for smaller gardens. Prune immediately after flowering. Developed in Canada.

name: 3.78L Spreading Juniper Specialty Shrub
description: Spreading juniper is a hardy shrub, with crisp, green foliage. An excellent, low-growing, spreading evergreen for use as a groundcover, in rock or mulch gardens, or cascading over walls.

name: Early Blooming Hydrangea #3 Flowering Plant
description: Mostly shade-loving, hydrangeas are easy to grow, hardy, disease and pest resistant, and exceptionally long-blooming. They are suitable as anchor plants in a mixed garden or in containers.

name: 2G Colour Cocktail Rose Shrub
description: This disease resistant rose puts on an incredible display of blossoms which emerge yellow, but then become pink, giving a multi-coloured look to the display. This vigorous, shrub rose puts on a beautiful kaleidoscopic display.

name: Combo Holly Shrub 2g
description: Combo Holly has blue prince and blue princess holly in the same pot. No need to buy 2 separate plants for pollination, the male and female plants are combined into one 2g pot. Combo Holly is an evergreen with glossy leaves and spiny edges. It produces bright red, festive berries and is extremely cold hardy. It grows into a dense shrub and can be enjoyed all year long.

name: 7.5L Potentilla White
description: Stunning, large pure white flowers on a compact and dense plant with blue-green foliage.  Beautiful Native specimen, resistant to pests & disease.  Drought tolerant and easy to maintain.  Lovely soft flowers bloom all season long from late Spring until late Fall.  Useful for foundation planting and mass planting. Prune back one third, in early Spring, for optimal results and to promote new growth and full blooms.

name: 7.5L Tor Spirea Flowering Shrub
description: Tor Spireais a compact mound of dark grey-green birch-like leaves. A show of bright white flowers cover the plant in late spring. They will repeat bloom if you dead head the old flowers. Great planted as a specimen or in group plantings. Planted as a hedge will give a nice show of white colour.

name: 12 inches pot hydrangea shrub with pink or blue blooms
description: One of the most popular perennials in landscaping, this one captivates us with its colorful flowering and easy maintenance. We have different varieties, some that will bloom pink and others that will bloom blue.

name: Spruce Montrose Charm Shrub 3g
description: The Spruce Montrose Charm is a unique evergreen shrub with an attractive upright pyramidal form. Its foliage is a beautiful blue-green in colour, with silver-tipped needles that give off a fragrant aroma. This hardy and low-maintenance plant is a great addition to any garden, providing year-round interest and a pleasant scent. It thrives in sunny, well-drained areas, and is tolerant of a variety of soils. It can reach heights of up to 3m, making it a great choice for tall hedging, screening, or as a specimen plant. The Spruce Montrose Charm is a great choice for any garden!

name: Hydrangea Phantom Shrub  2g
description: Phantom Hydrangea is a gorgeous shrub with stunning with showy cream coloured flowers that bloom summer through fall. A very ornamental shrub that is easy to grow and is a reliable bloomer. Fast growing with an upright spreading habit.

name: Smokebush Dusky Maiden Shrub 2g
description: Dusky Maiden Smokebush is a deciduous shrub with a stunning, vase-shaped form. It is highly sought after for its remarkable foliage and blooms. The foliage is a deep, dark purple-black color with a hint of blue. It is deeply cut, giving the shrub an interesting texture. In the spring and summer months, the shrub is covered in clusters of small, fluffy, pink-purple flowers. The flowers are sweetly scented and attract pollinators. The smokebush is a fast-growing shrub that can reach up to 6 feet tall and wide. It is drought tolerant and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is a great choice for adding color and interest to gardens, patios, and other outdoor spaces.

name: 1 Gal. 6-inch Dwarf Alberta Spruce Shrub
description: Picea g. at. 'Conica' # 1 gal. Alberta Spruce Mature size 2m x 1.2m Small conifer of naturally conical shape with very dense foliage. Low maintenance and prunning.

name: PW 19L Hydrangea Quick Fire Plant
description: Blooming weeks before any other hydrangeas, QuickFire keeps blooming for the longest bloom period. From crisp white through to luscious pink in the fall.

name: Azalea Shrub 2g
description: Azaleas are a type of flowering shrub native to many parts of the world. They are known for their bright and vibrant colors. Azaleas are commonly used in landscaping because of their low maintenance requirements and long-lasting blooms. They prefer acidic soil and partial shade, and often grow best in areas with high humidity. Azaleas are also known for their fragrant flowers, which bloom in the springtime. With proper care, they can last for years, providing a beautiful and unique addition to any garden.

name: Rosemary Blue Ice Bog Shrub 2g
description: A dwarf, low-growing, compact, spreading evergreen shrub with narrow blue-green leaves. Profuse clusters of small nodding pink bell-shaped flowers which almost cover the plant and obscure the attractive foliage are produced in spring.

name: 8-inch Japanese Maple Tree
description: Acer palmatum # 2 gal. Japanese maple. Mature size 2.5m x 2m Shrub with red purple foliage all season round. Protect from the cold winter winds. Very Decorative.

name: 2G English Roseum Rhododendron Shrub
description: Large trusses of rose coloured blossoms are produced above the thick, leathery foliage on this bushy evergreen shrub. This large, ornamental shrub is great for background planting or filling the space below deciduous trees.

name: 1 Gal. 6-inch Blue Star Juniper Shrub
description: Juniperus. 'Blue Star' # 1 gal. Mature size 30 cm x 60 cm Conifer with a very dwarf and compact form. Slow growth. Blue steel foliage.  Ideal for small gardens or rock gardens.

name: 8-inch Dense Spreading Yew Semi-Dwarf Shrub
description: Taxus m. Densiformis # 3 gal. Mature size 1.2m x 1.2m. Conifer with dark green foliage. Semi-dwarf compact form. Fertilize regularly. Plant in well-drained soil.

name: 8-inch Weigela f. Minuet Shrub
description: Weigela f. Minuet # 2 gal.  Mature size 50-75 cm x 50-75 cm. Shrubs that bloom in June and then in August with magenta pink flowers. Compact shrub with purple-green foliage.

name: 3G Collie Mullens Rose of Sharon Shrub
description: Slender, upright branches and thick bright green foliage. Large rose-pink, semi-double blooms. Highly tolerant of pollution and works well as a hedge or screen.

name: Pieris Scarlet O'Hara 2g - shrub
description: Scarlet O'Hara Pieris is a broadleaf evergreen shrub that has delicate and showy chains of small white bell-shaped flowers and bright red foliage, one of the hardiest cultivars; performs best in moist, organic and acidic soils. Glossy narrow leaves remain dark green throughout the winter.

name: 3 Gal. Rhododendron Flowering Plant

name: 2G Girard's Fuchsia Azalea Shrub

name: No. 2 Potted Weigela (Assorted)
description: Beautiful accent plant available in a variety of different colours.

name: 5.87L #10 Drop-N-Decorate Dipladenia Flowering Annual Shrub with Assorted  Colours and Combinations
description: Rio is a bush-type Dipladenia which is beautiful, durable and low-maintenance. Trumpet shaped flowers stand out atop shiny green foliage. Bred specifically for garden performance, Rios are non-stop bloomers for planters, garden beds and hanging baskets. Very little watering required. With built-in water storage in the form of tubers, Rios store water beneath the soil. Rios enjoy 4 plus hours of Sun daily but will also perform well in part-shade. No deadheading required, blooms will fade and fall off. Refer to plant tag for additional care. Our 1Qt Rio is ideal for landscape and DIY container gardening. Fall in love with the beauty and ease of Rio. Relax it's Rio.

name: 1g Juniper Blue Star Dwarf and Compact Evergreen
description: Dwarf and compact evergreen with dense, steel-blue foliage. The striking blue needles are very bright and stand out in the garden .The bluish needles retain their colour throughout the winter. Excellent for rock gardens, borders, edging, or training as bonsai. Slow growing. One of the most elegant dwarf evergreens in any garden.

name: 3G Dwarf Burning Bush Shrub
description: Spectacular crimson fall foliage follows rich green leaves in spring and summer. Adaptable to a variety of environmental conditions and can be pruned heavily to maintain desired shape.

name: Lilac Sensation 2g
description: Sensation Lilac is a deciduous shrub with gorgeous, fragrant blooms. Makes an excellent cut flower.  Has an upright habit and attracts butterflies. Makes a wonderful addition to your garden.

name: 2G Endless Summer Bloomstruck Hydrangea Shrub

name: Canada Day Rose Planter
description: Canada Day Rose Planter

name: 26.5L CWF Native Oak (Quercus palustris) Tree
description: Canada is home to approximately 451 bird species and billions of individual birds. Despite their numbers, the threats leading to declines in North American bird populations continue to grow. These include loss of habitat, invasive species, pesticides, toxic chemicals, pollution, cat predation, decrease in insect prey numbers, climate change, disease and death resulting from man-made obstacles like wind turbines and impact with windows of buildings during migration. As a result, nearly 15 per cent of native bird species are at risk of extinction. There is something you can do to help improve life for birds in your area.For starters, incorporate trees and shrubs from CWF's new WILD About Birds collection into your garden and landscaping projects.

name: 3G Helene Rose of Sharon Shrub
description: White, heavily ruffled flowers with a reddish purple eye complement leathery dark green leaves. Blooms nearly continuously over a long season.

name: PW Weigela Wine and Roses 5g

These elegant trees make a unique addition to any garden, with foliage ranging from delicate lacy leaves to variegated leaves in a rainbow of rich, beautiful colours from red and green to pinks and white highlights. Landscape designers love Japanese maples because they can be used in so many ways to add unique texture in the landscape.

name: 7 lb. California Lilac #2 Shrub

name: 2G Girard's Hot Shot Azalea Shrub

Its deep green foliage provides a beautiful backdrop for the vibrant blooms and turns golden yellow in fall. Growing to a maximum of 4 feet tall and wide, Pink Beauty Potentilla is a compact shrub that fits in any yard and requires minimal maintenance. This hardy shrub is perfect for providing a splash of color in borders, rock gardens, or as a flowering hedge. It also attracts birds, bees, and butterflies with its sweet flowers.

name: Peking Cotoneaster #1 Pot

The best uses for the Rosy Glow Barberry include hedges, privacy screening, foundation planting, or as the main focal point in your garden.

name: 2G Confetti Hydrangea Shrub

The Aloe Vera is unique as it can be used as a multi-purpose plant.  Not only is the gel in the stalk known to help heal skin irritations such as minor scrapes and burns, but it is also a very beautiful succulent plant that is very simple to grow indoors.  This plant does not require much water.  When the soil seems dry, water until the soil is moist.

description: A beautiful hydrangea that will be sure to draw you in! Add these hydrangeas into your home décor for a pop of colour. Large flowers shaped into stunning domes of blooms.

name: 10-inch Eugenia Topiary Double Ball Plant
description: A Eugenia plant is an Australian evergreen with small, glossy green leaves. Although it can grow into any shape, the plant responds especially well to training as a ball, either a single ball or several balls connected by a central, bare stem. Eugenia is quite resilient and requires little special care when given the right growing conditions. Full sun for the morning hours, followed by partial shade in the afternoon, is ideal. It isn't a good choice for a fully shaded spot, where it tends to lose leaf color and become leggy, an undesirable growth habit for a topiary. When growing Eugenia as a container-plant indoors, keep it in a brightly lit, south- or west-facing window, or supplement its light with fluorescent lighting. Key the soil well-drained as it does poorly in soil that tends to stay wet for long periods. Fertilizing a Eugenia topiary regularly helps keep To support the plant's foliage bright green and growth, fertilize regularly using 10-10-10 fertilizer

description: The Pachira aquatica is a tropical native to Central and South America.  Many cultures believe this plant brings good luck and fortune.  This plant is very easy to take care of.  Keep the soil moist, but not drenched.  A timed released fertilizer should be fed once every 3 months.  The Money Tree makes a perfect addition to any decor creating a Feng Shui space.

name: Orchid Phalaenopsis in 5-inch Ceramic Pot
description: Enhance your living space with this ready to display orchid. Comes in an assortment of colours with single or mulit stems in a 5 inch decorative, ceramic pot. The beautiful blooms are perfect for any room, office or reception area. These orchids are also a great gift idea that will bring a smile to everyone's face and will cheer up any space. An orchid is known for its elegance and architectural shape. Orchids do not need as much water as people usually think. In fact, they only use a few ounces of water every 7-days to 12-days depending on the humidity. Orchids also love to be misted in the morning to raise the humidity around the orchid.  Orchids can hold their blooms for over a month and then the leftover spike can be trimmed to prepare the plant for the next spike or spikes. Orchids will normally only flower 1-year.

name: 10-inch Eugenia Topiary, 3 Balls
description: This plant is an indoor living sculpture that will draw everyones eyes.  Its tall pruned shaped balls create a beautiful focal point.  It excels when placed near a window with plenty of light.  Many people appreciate its air purifying capabilities.

description: Enhance the beauty of your home or office with these elegant tillandsias.          Very hardy, these air plants require partial shade and mist watering. Perfect for easy DIY project.

name: 3-inch White Overpot Purple 1 Stem Orchid Phalaenopsis Plant
description: There are up to 30,000 different species of orchids and is the largest family of plants in the world.  The Orchid Phalaenopsis is the most common orchid available due to the availability, ease of growing, amounts and length of blooms and do very well as a houseplant.  The orchid requires moderate light conditions.  Watering should be done once per week. Recommended temperatures are 15C - 25C.   This plant comes with a trendy  upgrade pot.  With each bloom being unique, orchids make spaces look sophisticated and elegant.

description: Enhance the beauty of your home or office with these elegant tillandsias.          Very hardy, these air plants require partial shade and mist watering. Perfect for easy DIY project.
